Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 1 sac de farine, 10 kg de sucres, les levures, etc. Elle remercie l’IMF Hekima pour ce premier crédit qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle, car grâce à ce crédit, elle va améliorer son capital et à subvenir aux multiples besoins de sa famille.Il sied de signer certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: This client, Kabugho, is the leader of the Canaane loan group. She is a young entrepreneur, bravely dealing with her situation, and is 30 years old. She is married and has three young children. Her husband is a broker for a transportation carrier. This featured client sells beignets and cakes that she makes using local technology. She began this business with her own funds, given to her by her husband. However, she just received her first loan with the microfinance institution Hekima. This group recently joined Hekima's microfinance program. This client is full of hope for her business. This new loan should allow her to supply herself with one bag of flour, 10 kg of sugar, yeast, etc. She is grateful to Hekima for this first loan she is receiving without the need for a material guarantee, because thanks to this loan, she is going to improve her capital and provide for her family's various needs. It should be noted that certain clients in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: To buy one bag of flour, 10 kg of sugar, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot runs a little cafe in Kapan town. He started this business almost seven months ago. During this period, Ashot's cafe has become popular among citizens, because it is placed in one of the most beautiful and popular places in town.

Now, Ashot would like to refresh the crockery and furniture in the cafe and add new ones. He also plans to purchase some drinks for the cafe. Thus, Ashot has applied for this loan to implement his plans. Development of the business is important for Ashot to earn more income and sustain his family. Ashot lives with his wife, Satenik, and little two-year-old son.

loans.use: to pay for crockery, furniture and drinks.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is married with four children. Rosalinda is 54 years old, and resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Rosalinda owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 9,800 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next cropping. In 2008, Rosalinda joined GDMPC. In the future, Rosalinda wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next cropping.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential goods.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods like rice, sugar, pasho, and cooking oil, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits. It will help her add more goods to sell and increase her profits. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a larger supermarket.

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more goods like rice, sugar, pasho, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Ran is 39 years old, married and has five children. She lives in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district of Kompong Cham province, where rice farming is the common main source of a family’s income for most of the villagers, as well as Ran’s family. 

Ran has been involved in this agricultural business for almost 20 years. She is able to earn about KHR 18,000 per day from the current business and she can save about KHR 8,000 each. Ran's group consists of four female members; Ran is a 3rd cycle loan client, another two members are 2nd cycle loan clients, and the remaining one is a first cycle client. 

Ran has managed to use the past two loans with success to retain her standard of living better than before. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion, in amount of 1,200,000 KHR, to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes to have a plentiful harvest so that she can earn more income for her family’s sake.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 27 years of age and has been in active farming since her teenage years in her rural home of Kitale, Western Kenya. Her farm products, which include maize, eggs, milk and beans, are sold within the local market. She runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. She is married and has three children between 1 and 9 years of age.

Dorothy has made a request of a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will give a boost to her dairy farming. She aims at having a farm of ten dairy cows in the future and a vehicle to help her in making deliveries of her produce to the markets. She will also be able to offer transportation services to other farmers.

Dorothy sees lack of capital and defined local markets for farm produce as the main challenges in her business. But, she remains optimistic that the loan will generate more income to help diversify her farming business. She  prays for growth of Juhudi to be able to support more smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is a married man. He has a son who is 1 year old. He describes himself to be a business-oriented man. He operates a nissan, from which he provides transportation. He has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located within a busy route and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy nissan spare parts. His business goal is to buy one more nissan within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will build rental houses with profits generated.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the Nissan.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is married and a mother of three dependents. She is 42 years old and lives in Libertad, Tukuran. Rosenda owns and operates a tricycle transport business. She established the business as a way of generating extra income of 3,600 per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 2 years. 

Rosenda has requested a loan of 7,000 from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase tricycle spare parts and accessories. Rosenda been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Rosenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Zaidha

texts.en:
Zaidha is 25 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 1.5 years, Zaidha has been working hard to manage her electronics shop, which sells phones, accessories and video cards. 

To help expand her business, Zaidha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phones to sell, and will help Zaidha to generate greater profits and allow her to build a house. Zaidha hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own a bigger phone shop. 

Zaidha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Zaidha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more phones to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is involved im agriculture. Together with her husband, Samvel, she runs a farm, where they breed cows, pigs, chickens and grow fruit trees. Rita needs some financial investments to purchase necessary grass to feed the cattle. As the climate in this region is cold and not favorable, Rita has some challenges with growing enough grass to feed the livestock. This loan will help Rita to manage with his challenge and to keep stable development of her farm.

loans.use: to pay for grass to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Hydrice

texts.fr: Hydrice est un jeune homme de 27 ans célibataire sans enfant .il est commerçant dans un marché d'une banlieue depuis 01 an où il vend des vêtements neufs dans une petite boutique qu'il gère lui même.Malgré la jeunesse de son activité,il a pu conquérir en si peu de temps une clientèle considérable et de plus en plus exigeante et dont il n'arrive plus à satisfaire la demande; Ce qui est un problème qui à long terme risque d'entrainer une diminution considérable de celle-ci.Dans le but d'éviter ce risque,il voudrait donc ce crédit pour acheter des vêtements neufs en grande quantité ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire  la demande et de répondre aux exigeances de ses clients.Cela entrainera par conséquent l'augmentation de ses ventes et donc de ses bénéfices.Ces bénéfices l'aideront d'une à agrandir et étendre son activité et d'autre part de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Hydrice is a young man who is 27, single, and has no children.  

He is a retailer and has been working at a suburban market for one year:  he sells new clothes in a small shop that he runs by himself.  

Although his business is still very "young", Hydrice has been able to attract a large number of customers whose needs are increasing, and he can no longer meet all the demand.  This represents a problem, since, in the long run, he might lose the demand from his customers.

In order to prevent this from happening, he is requesting the current loan to buy a large quantity of new clothes.  This will allow him to satisfy his customers' demand and to meet their expectations.  This will also lead to increased sales, and therefore to increased profits.

Additional profits will allow him, on the one hand, to increase and expand his activity, and on the other hand, to meet his daily needs.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is a married woman. She has nine children with ages ranging from 4 years old to 26 years old. She describes herself to be humble and God-fearing. She operates a food stall where she sells clothes material and snacks. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of stock for resale to meet the high demand of customers. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy clothes material and food ingredients for making snacks for sale. Her business goal is to be a distributor of clothes material within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will diversify her business into building rental houses for housing accomodation.

loans.use: to buy more clothes material and food ingredients for preparing snacks for resale.

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is a 31-year-old retailer form Lernadzor village. About two months ago, Marat decided to start his own business to have a stable and independant income. Marat founded a little shop where he trades with food and drinks. As the busness is new, Marat does not have enough funds to invest in its development. Marat has applied for this loan to purchase food and drinks, and to increase inventory variety in the shop. This will allow Marat to gather more income and to invest in further development of his business.

Marat lives with his wife and two sons: 3-year old Alex and 7-year-old Ashot. Stable developemnt of the business is important for Marat to sustain his family and to ensure a brighter future for them.

loans.use: to pay for food and drinks.

loans.name: Esmelina

texts.en: Esmelina is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 59 years old. Esmelina is a widow and has one child. To make a living, she manages a fish-selling business. She's been engaged in fish vending for two years and earns 8,400 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Esmelina joined GDMPC. Esmelina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Tongnooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOMPASSEKDE  est la représentante du groupe TONGNOOMA. Mme va très bien. Elle a acheté les habits comme prévu. Elle est mariée  et n’a pas d’enfant. Personne ne va à l’école. Elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend des  vêtements prêt à porter pour  femmes, filles et garçons depuis  03ans. Avec ses bénéfices réalisées, elle a pu réalisé beaucoup de choses dans sa famille. Mme a renouvelé son crédit et compte travailler pour mieux rentabiliser son travail. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché du secteur 10 en ville .Ses clients sont  les femmes, les filles et les enfants.

Elle veut  s’acheter  03douzaines de hauts pour femmes et filles et 1 douzaine de complets  pour enfants et des pagnes.

 Elle épargne  ses bénéfices pour  agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne  acquérir un motocycle et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Sompassekde is the representative of the TONGNOOMA group.  She is doing very well and has been able to buy clothes, as she expected.  She is married and has no children, therefore no one attends school.  She has one person in her care.

For the past three years she has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for women, girls and boys.  With her profits, she has been able to do many things for her family.  

She has renewed her loan and is planning to work in a way that her work is more profitable.  She stocks up at the 10th district in town.  Her customers are women, girls and children.

She wants to buy three dozen tops for women and girls, one dozen complete outfits for children, and some "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics).

Sompassekde saves her profits to expand her business.  Her ambition is to purchase a motorized bicycle and to contribute to the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy three dozen "tops" for women and girls, one dozen complete outfits for children, and some "pagnes".

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is a married woman with three children. She is 35 years old and resides in Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, in the Philippines. Elvie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. Recently, Elvie joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es: Ulises produce brochas para pinturas desde el año 1985, cuando dio inicio a su negocio, después de haber sido vendedor de una empresa dedicada a comercializar este producto. El  fabrica en su negocio brochas de 1” a 6 “  y las distribuye en ferreterías y pequeños almacenes y ferreterías, las que se han convertido en sus principales clientes. Su proceso productivo inicia cuando elabora el cabo, procesa las cerdas, amarra, pinta y comercializa, trabajando con énfasis la preventa para producir ajustándose a la demanda. Sus ventas las realiza de martes a viernes y trabaja durante 8 horas diarias, mientras sus compras las hace de contado en el matadero del municipio donde compra el pelo y la madera la compra en los aserraderos. Su mayor desafio para extender su mercado es que no cuenta con un capital de trabajo suficiente para invertir en lateias primas e inusmos y para lograr fabricar un mayor número de brochas en un menor costo. Esta es la razón por la cual  está aplicando a un credikiva, el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el que comprará madera en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos, que disminuyen sus costos productivos y para lograr fabricar en un numero de unidadess, superiores a las que fabrica, y ofrecer mejores opciones de precios a sus clientes reales y potenciales.
texts.en: Ulises has been making paintbrushes since the year 1985, when he started his business, after having been a salesman for a company dedicated to marketing these products. In his business, he makes brushes from 1 to 6 inches and distributes them in hardware stores and in little warehouses and hardware stores, which have become his principal customers. His productive process begins when he makes the handle, processes the bristles, ties, paints and markets them. He puts special emphasis on pre-sale efforts, so that he can adjust his production to the demand. He sells from Tuesday to Friday, and works 8 hours a day. Whereas for his purchases, he makes them in cash in the municipal slaughterhouse where he buys the hair, and the wood he buys in the sawmills. His biggest challenge to expanding his market is that he doesn’t have the working capital necessary to invest in raw materials and inputs in order to fabricate a greater number of paintbrushes at a lower cost. This is the reason why he is applying for a Kivaloan, his first financial arrangement with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this, he will buy wood at a greater volume in order to get discounts that will reduce his production costs and in order to achieve a greater number of units made, and to offer better price options to his current and potential customers.

loans.use: to buy wood in greater volume.

loans.name: Toch's Group

texts.en:
Toch is a 41-year-old married woman living in the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey, Cambodia. She has five children but is currently only living with her three children who work for others for a fee at a minimal income. To provide daily sustenance to her family, Toch grows rice paddies as her primary source of income and runs a small stall from her home to sell grocery items as additional income. 

Having been involved in this business for 21 years, she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day from daily expenses. However, low crop yield is still the main challenge to her business. To tackle this challenge, she leads a group of two in applying for a new loan. With VisionFund, this is the third loan cycle for Toch and the other group member. The past two loans have made Toch's business and standard of living improve progressively. 

Now, she and the other member are applying for a new loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use a portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and another portion of it to buy more grocery items to resell, including soap, food ingredients, canned food and shampoo. Toch hopes that she will be able to double her income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and additional grocery items to resell.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married with five children and three of them go to school. She doesn‘t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works at the market seven days a week and on retail.  She doesn't have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  

Aida aspires to see her business grow so that she becomes a wholesaler and to also buy a delivery van to ease in transportation. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ning's Group

texts.en:
Ning, aged 24, is a citizen from Kror Lanh district, Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has one son who still dependent on her. To earn a living, she has been cultivating rice on 1.5 hectares of land and supplements the family’s income by raising one pig. Ning has been involved in this business for several years. The current business earns her approximately KHR 10,000 per day, and she manages to save about KHR 5,000 each day.

Ning has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the loans while the other member has been with them for three cycles. She has used the past loans to better support her family’s business. Ning is leading the group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She and the other member are applying for KHR 700,000 and KHR 400,000, respectively. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes to increase income from the crop yield in order to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and buy more piglets.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Booku Diom Group

texts.fr: 	BOOKU DIOM est une association de femmes située à environ quelques kilomètres de la ville principale, elle est  composée de 5 membres qui cotisent chaque jour 200 f et  dirigée par sa Présidente Mme Sokhna Berry qui se trouve au mileu. Mme Sokhna est mariée et mère de famille, elle  évolue dans le commerce depuis 3 ans, elle achète des thioups à Thiès pour aller les vendre à foundioune en rendant visite son mari qui est  maintenancier à l’hôpital de foundioune, de labà elle achète des fruits de mer qu’elle vienne vendre à Thiès. Mme Sokhna Berry demande un crédit de 375 000 f, avec ce prêt  elle compte acheter  plus de marchandises  et faire plus de bénéfices de ce fait elle pourra épargner et subvenir à ses besoins. Elle veut un jour avoir son autonomie financière pour voler de ses propres ailes
texts.en: Booku Diom is a women's group located a few kilometers from the main city. It consists of five members who contribute 200 francs per day and is directed by its president, Mrs. Sokhna Berry, who is in the middle of the photo.  Mrs. Sokhna is married and a mother. She has been in business for three years. She buys "thioup" fabric in Thies for resale in Foundioune when she visits her husband who is a maintenance man at the Foundioune Hospital.  There, she buys seafood that she resells in Thies.  Mrs. Sokhna is requesting a loan of 375,000 francs. With this loan she plans to buy more goods and make more profit. As a result, she will be able to save money and provide for her needs.  She wants, one day, to be financially independent and to fly with her own wings.

loans.use: to buy "thioup" fabric in Thies for resale in Foundioune and with this new capital, to buy seafood in Foundioune for resale in Thies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old, married, and blessed with six children aged 17, 15, 13, 10, eight, and the last being nine months old. She sells fruits and vegetables, a business she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has requested a second loan worth KES 24,000 to purchase more fruits, vegetables, and cereals for sale. The anticipated profit will aid her to educate her children. 

Her dream is to see herself prosper in her business as well as purchase a plot for her children to settle on.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits, vegetables, and cereals for sale.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 21,000 pesos Socorro ha podido comprar una estación para lavar el pelo y un sillón para su salón de belleza. Su intención es que con ésta inversión su clientela aumente y por ende los ingresos que ella percibe a través del negocio. Socorro es casada, su esposo es maestro constructor y juntos han procreado a cuatro hijos de 14, 11, 7 y 2 años, todos los que están en edad escolar están asistiendo a la escuela.
Socorro se esfuerza cada día en brindarle un buen servicio a sus clientes, pues la competencia en salones de belleza es muy grande en la República Dominicana. Es el segundo negocio más popular. La mujer dominicana va en promedio 1 vez a la semana al salón de belleza. En el barrio de Socorro se cobra 2.50 USD por estilizar el pelo. 
Socorro y su esposo quiere asegurarse de proveerles una mejor alimentación a sus hijos, así como una buena educación.
texts.en:
With a loan of 21,000 DOP, Socorro has been able to buy a shampoo station and chair for her beauty salon.  Her goal through this investment is to increase her clientele and the income she earns through her business.  Socorro is married and her husband is a master builder.  They have four children, ages 14, 11, 7 and 2, and all the school-aged ones attend school.

Everyday Socorro makes every effort to provide the best customer service she can, since competition between beauty salons is huge in the Dominican Republic.  It is the second most popular business, as the Dominican women go to the beauty salon on average once a week.  Socorro charges 2.50 USD to style hair.

Socorro and her husband want to make sure they can provide the best nutrition and a good education for their children.

loans.use: To buy a shampoo station and chair for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr:
Mme HELENE est marié et mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des pagnes depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont un peu partout dans la ville car ambulante.

Elle veut s’acheter 08 pièces de pagnes.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne poursuivre son activité afin d’ouvrir sa propre boutique.
texts.en: Mrs. Helene is married and mother of four children; the oldest is 14 years old and the youngest is 1 year old.  Three attend school. She has five dependents.  She has sold "pagne" fabric for five years. She stocks up at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are all over the city because she is a street vendor.  She wants to buy eight pieces of "pagne" cloth. With her profits, she wants to strengthen her business. Her goal is to continue her business in order to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy 8 pieces of "pagne" cloth.

loans.name: Edison Roberto

texts.es:
Edison es una persona honrada, paciente, de buen humor y muy responsable en su trabajo. Edison vive con su mamá en Atuntaqui que se encuentra cerca de Otavalo.

Edison trabaja con su mamá en la crianza de animales como: cerdos, pollos, negocio que les ayuda a sustentar los gastos de su hogar y los estudios de Edison, actualmente solicitó un crédito a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la adecuación de  los corrales de los cerdos y para construir un galpon de pollos y comprar pollos blancos para crianza y venta.

Edison sueña en que su negocio sea grande y poder distribuir a grandes empresas.
texts.en:
Edison is an honest, patient, good-humored person who is very responsible in his work.  He lives with his mother in Atuntaqui, which is near Otavalo.

He and his mother raise animals such as pigs and chickens, to earn an income to cover household expenses and pay for Edison's education costs.  Edison recently requested a loan through Fodemi which will be used to upgrade the pig stye and build a chicken coop.  He also will buy white chickens to raise and sell.

Edison's goal is to expand his business and distribute to large companies.

loans.use: To upgrade the pig stye, build a chicken coop and buy white chickens.

loans.name: Jhonny Alberto

texts.es:
Jhonny de 53 años de edad vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a orillas del mar Caribe y es un potencial turístico muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí se dedica a la venta de fritos y bollos limpios: un  amasijo típico de Caribe Colombiano, que es un alimento de origen indígena a base de masa de maíz, envuelto en hojas de este mismo vegetal, el cual   se cuece o sancocha en agua hirviendo y resulta ser un alimento muy saludable.  
Este negocio lo inició su esposa hace 21 años, pues antes de dedicarse a él fue agente de policía, tendero, comerciante de ropa etc, de allí su experiencia en el mercado. La Jornada laboral de Jhonny la inicia desde las 3 de la mañana y  finaliza a las 9 de la mañana.  Entre los productos fritos que comercializa están las arepas, los buñuelos y los fines de semana adiciona los famosos pasteles, o amasijos de arroz con verduras y varias carnes que envuelven en hoja de bijao para su cocción. El proceso productivo lo tiene ubicado en un salón de su casa, donde los clientes ingresan por un portón a comprarle; en su tarea tiene mucha acogida la calidad que practica al elabora los productos  y  también el atractivo precio que ofrece, que oscila entre $200 COP. y 700 COP , de acuerdo con la capacidad de cada persona. Jhonny se siente muy feliz, pues vive en una amplia casa, que tiene hermosos acabados, y  como el mismo dice,  lo ha logrado gracias a la venta de sus fritos y demás alimentos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  maíz al por mayor, así como también aceite vegetal, lácteos y también realizará reformas locativas, para hacer cada vez mas cómodas las instalaciones por donde circulan sus clientes, pues quiere que se sientan en un ambiente confortable y regresen.
texts.en:
Jhonny, 53, lives in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, on the Caribbean Coast.  It is a tourist area near the city of Barranquilla.  There he sells fried foods and a typical Colombian Caribbean corn-based dough which is wrapped in corn leaves and cooked or boiled to make it into a healthy food.  He began the business with his wife 21 years ago, since his previous jobs were policeman, shop owner, clothing merchant, etc., which gave him experience in the market.

Jhonny's workday begins at 3:00 a.m. and ends at 9:00 a.m.  Among the fried foods he sells are "arepas" (tortillas), and doughnuts, and on weekends he adds the famous pastry and rice and vegetable or meat balls cooked in bijao leaves.  He carries out the production process in the living room of his house and customers come to order at the front door.  He has a lot of customers because of the quality of his products and the good prices he offers ranging between 200 and 700 COP, depending on each person's capacity.  Jhonny is very happy because he lives in a big house with beautiful finished work.  As he says, he has been able to obtain it thanks to his fried food sales.  

He is currently applying for a CrediKiva loan, which is his first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which he will use to buy wholesale corn, vegetable oil, and dairy products, and he will also renovate his food shop to make it more comfortable for customers to come in, enjoy the atmosphere, and come back.

loans.use: To buy wholesale corn, vegetable oil, and dairy products, and renovate his food shop.

loans.name: Julieth

texts.es: Julieth  con su anterior crédito confecciono uniformes, ropa informal y ropa para dormitorios cuales  vendió y aumentó su capital de trabajo. Ella está muy satisfecha, pues esto fue gracias a su credikiva, por eso se dispone a acceder a tercer crédikiva,  con el cual fortalecerá su otro negocio de carnes frías, comprando en un mayor volumen,  porque su clientela ha crecido y cada vez tiene mas pedidos. Así mismo una parte de su nuevo crédito, lo utilizará  para comprar telas y fabricar los uniformes de una organización educativa. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Gracias por el apoyo en mi negocio y continuaré respondiendo con pagos puntuales “
texts.en: Julieth used her previous loan to make uniforms, casual clothes and sleepwear which she sold to increase her working capital.  She is very satisfied because this was thanks to her CrediKiva.  Therefore she is about to take out her third CrediKiva loan to strengthen her other business which is cold meats.  She will buy in bulk since her customer base has grown and she is constantly receiving more orders.  Part of the new loan will be used to buy fabric to make uniforms for an educational organization.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  "Thank you for the support you are giving to my business.  I will continue to pay back the loan on time".

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and cold meats.

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 21,000 pesos Ramón Antonio podrá acondicionar el local de su centro de llamadas e Internet, cambiar la puerta, las ventanas y comprar un aire acondicionado usado. Esto le ayudará a mejorar la imagen del negocio y hacerlo más cómodo para sus clientes. 
Ramón Antonio tiene este negocio desde hace cinco años. Inició con dos cabinas y ha ampliado el negocio hasta tener cinco cabinas. 
Ramón Antonio es casado, su esposa trabaja en la Alcaldía Municipal. Tienen una hija de 9 años, que asiste a la escuela. 
El deseo de Ramón Antonio es diversificar el negocio y además operar una agencia de viajes. Entiende que este negocio puede ser sostenible, ya que muchas personas de su comunidad tienen que viajar a otra ciudad cuando desean utilizar los servicios de una agencia de viajes.
texts.en:
With a loan in the amount of 21,000 DOP, Ramón Antonio will be able to renovate his calling service and Internet center by changing the doors and windows, and buying a used air conditioning unit.  This will help improve his corporate image and make it more comfortable for his customers.

Ramón Antonio has been in business for five years.  He started with two booths and has expanded to five.  He is married and his wife works for the municipal mayor's office.  They have a nine-year-old daughter who attends school.

Ramón Antonio's goal is to diversify his business and also open a travel agency.  He believes this business is sustainable because many people in his community must travel to other cities ehn they want to have access to travel services.

loans.use: To renovate his calling service and Internet center, changing the door and windows, and buying a used air conditioning unit.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 30 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente se cultiva el algodón, la uva, esparrago, entre otros, podemos encontrar también lugares turísticos como lo es la linda “Laguna e Huacachina”, ubicada en medio de Dunas impresionantes y en las cuales se puede practicar deportes de aventura como el sanboard. Como buen peruano le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquísimo “arroz con pollo”. Jose estudio la carrera de Técnico electricista, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar en la universidad.

Día a día Jose trabaja en su negocio de  reparación y venta de equipos celulares y accesorios para los mismos, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 35 clientes al día; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable u cumplido con sus clientes.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas eléctricas como medidores de energía, desarmadores, alicates, entre otras herramientas necesarias para brindar su servicio, de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Jose is a very hard-working man. He is 30 years old and lives in the city of Ica, which is known for having a very warm and welcoming climate. The city also has an active agricultural sector, especially for the cultivation of cotton, grapes, and asparagus, among others. In the area one also finds tourist attractions such as the beautiful “Laguna de Huacachina," a lake that lies amid impressive sand dunes, where one can practice adventure sports such as sandboarding. As a good Peruvian, Jose loves to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious "arroz con pollo” [chicken with rice]. Jose studied for the profession of electrical technician, but he would have liked to study at the university. 

Every day, Jose works in his business repairing and selling cell phone equipment and accessories. He works about 8 hours per day, and he can serve up to 35 customers per day. He believes that his business is going well for him because he is very responsible and reliable with his customers. 

Jose is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have provided to him he will be able to buy electrical tools such as electricity meters, screwdrivers and pliers, among other tools that are necessary to provide his service. In this way he will increase his income and he will be able to keep working to achieve his greatest dream: "to build a home."

loans.use: To buy tools (electricity meters, screwdrivers and pliers, among others).

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 48 años, se describe como una persona trabajadora, responsable con su familia y con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida. Rosa vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en Otavalo.

Rosa trabaja con su familia en la confección de chalinas y blusas que son parte de la vestimenta de los indígenas de Otavalo, en este negocio lleva trabajando 20 años, su producción vendía en ferias lo que no le permitía vender ambulantemente por cuestión de permisos; es por eso que Rosa realiza un crédito en Fodemi para invertir en la compra de un puesto para vender sus prendas que confeccionan y para sacar los permisos que necesitan, lo que permitirá dar a conocer sus producciones y poder obtener buenos ingresos.

Rosa sueña que sus hijos sean profesionales y que administren su negocio de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Rosa, 48, describes herself as a hard worker who is responsible for her family and eager to succeed in life. Rosa lives with her husband and two children in Otavalo.

Rosa works with her family making of shawls and blouses, which form part of the native Otavalo Indian dress. She has been working in this business for 20 years. She sells her merchandise at fairs, as she does not have permission to sell on the streets. Therefore Rosa has applied for a loan with FODEMI so that she can invest in the purchase of a stall to sell the clothes she makes and to obtain the necessary permissions, which will raise awareness of her products and enable her to earn a good income.

Rosa's dream is for her children to become professionals, and to improve the management of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stall to sell the clothes she makes and to obtain the necessary permissions

loans.name: Claudette Vivienne

texts.fr: Vivienne est une femme de 35 ans,mariée,mère de 02 enfants dont l'un va déjà à l'école.Elle a également sous sa charge une autre personne.Elle est commerçante dans la capitale depuis 02 ans. Elle achète les viandes telles le poulet,le porc et la viande de boeuf dans les brousses pour  fumer et les revendre ensuite.Grâce à son savoir faire et à son accueil chaleureux,elle a conquis et fidélisée une clientèle et là,la demande devient supérieur à son offre.D'où l'importance de ce crédit qui l'aidera à augmenter son stock de marchandises en achetant plus de poulets,porcs et viandes de brousses.Cela lui permettra de satisfaire sa clientèle,augmenter ses ventes et ainsi sa marge bénéficiaire.Vivianne économisera une partie de son bénéfice pour la réinvestir ultérieurement dans son activité afin de l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Vivienne is a 35-year old woman, married, and mother of two children, one of which is already attending school. Vivienne also has one additional dependent.  She has been in business in the capital city for two years.  She buys meats such as chicken, pork, and bushmeat to smoke and then resells them.  Thanks to her skill and warm welcome, she has won loyal customers and now, demand is greater than supply.  Hence the importance of this loan which will help her to increase her inventory by buying more chicken, pork, and bushmeat.  This will allow her to satisfy her customers, increase her sales, and thus her profit margins.  Vivienne will save a part of her profits to later reinvest in her busness in order to expand it.  The rest will allow her to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pork, and bushmeat.

loans.name: Gladyz

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 44 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, la cual es una ciudad que recibe muchos turistas en todo el año ya que van a visitar uno de los atractivos turísticos más característicos de la zona, la cual son las líneas de nazca, se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, pallar, tuna, cochinilla, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho leer y sobre todo pasar tiempo con su familia, ya que es madre de 2 hijos de 18 y 9 años y trabaja muy duro  trabajan muy duro para darles lo mejor y hacerlos personas de bien, ella los ama muchísimo y por ello daría la vida. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de administración de empresas.

Día a día Gladys trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y productos de belleza, trabaja alrededor de 7 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y dedicada.

Gladys está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han bridando ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como tarrajeo de paredes, colocación de ventanas, puertas y instalación de servicios eléctricos, ya que actualmente no tiene luz en su vivienda, así de esta manera ella tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder terminar de construir su vivienda y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Gladyz, 44, lives in the city of Nazca. The city receives many tourists throughout the year, who come to visit one of the most distinctive attractions in the area, the Nazca Lines. The area has developed around agriculture, particularly cotton farming, lima beans, tuna, and cochineal, among others. 

When Gladyz has free time, she enjoys reading and especially spending time with her family. As the mother of 2 children aged 18 and 9, she works very hard to give them the best and raise them as good people, she loves them so much and would die for them. Because of limited financial resources Gladyz could only study up to the fifth grade of secondary education, but she would have liked to pursue a career in business administration.

Gladyz works daily in her small business selling clothes and beauty products. She works around 7 hours per day and can serve up to 10 clients each day. She believes that her business is doing well because she is very responsible and dedicated .

Gladyz is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to your help she is able to make improvements to her home, such as plastering the walls, positioning windows and doors, and installing electrical services - they currently have no light in their home and thus they will achieve a better quality of life. Gladyz will continue fighting to achieve her greatest dream: "To be able to finish building her house and provide a good education for her children."

loans.use: to make improvements to her home, (plastering, positioning windows and doors, installing electrical services, among others)

loans.name: Abizera Group

texts.fr:
Godelieve fait partie du groupe  Abizera et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 25 ans et est mariée à marc, un maçon. 

Elle fait le commerce des produits vivriers (tomates, bananes, aubergines,…) depuis  3 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  des tomates, aubergines, bananes, ... en grande quantité, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Le profit de son commerce lui permet de nourrir sa famille.
texts.en: Godelieve is a member of the Abizera Group and lives in Gitega. She is 25 years old and is married to Marc, a mason.  She has been in the business of food products for three years.  She is on her third loan with Turame. With ker Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy tomatoes, eggplant, and bananas, etc. in large quantities for resale to earn more. The profits from her business will enable her to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, eggplant, and bananas.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 44 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 23 years, Cissy has been working hard to manage her garment shop, which sells ladies, men's and children's wear. 

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more mens' wear and ladies' bags, and will help Cissy to generate greater profits and increase her income level to allow her to pay school fees. Cissy hopes that in the future she will be able to own her own supermarket. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Cissy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more mens' wear and ladies' bags

loans.name: Berthe

texts.fr: Berthe est une femme de 45 ans,divorcée et mère de 02 enfants qui vont encore à l'école.Elle a également sous sa charge une autre personne.Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 08 ans déjà où elle commercialise des vivres frais (tomates, poivrons).Elle a une bonne clientèle ,mais son capital ne lui permet pas d'acheter assez de marchandises pour satisfaire cette clientèle.Ceci est dû au fait que la quantité de marchandise qu'elle achète avec son capital pour détailler ne suffit plus à la clientèle à cause de la constante rupture de stock.Elle voudrait donc ce crédit afin d'acheter des cajots de tomates et des poivrons en gros ce qui lui permettra de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et d'éviter leur perte.Cela entrainera une augmentation de ses ventes et donc de ses bénéfices. Ces bénéfices l'aideront à payer la scolarité de ses enfants et elle  économisera également pour réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en: Berthe is 45 years old, divorced, and mother of two children that still attend school. She also has one other dependent.  She has been a merchant at one of markets for eight years already. She sells fresh food (tomatoes, bell peppers).  She has many customers, but her capital does not allow her to buy enough goods to satisfy her customers.  This is to because the amount of goods she buys with her funds no longer meets the demand of her customers due to being constantly sold-out. Therefore, she would like this loan to buy crates of tomatoes and bell peppers wholesale, which will allow her to meet the demand of her customers and avoid losing sales.  This will also lead to an increase in sales and thus her profits.  The profits will help her to pay for her children's school fees and she will also save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy crates of tomatoes and bell peppers.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: Víctor de 48 años de edad tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones en su casa, ubicada al sur occidente de la ciudad; su negocio lo inició desde hace  12 años, una vez quedó desempleado cuando trabajó en una sastrería, lugar donde adquirió conocimientos en el arte de preparar acabar y ensamblar piezas de confección y decidió generar de manera autónoma sus propios ingresos. Sus principales líneas de productos son los vestidos para damas, camisetas infantiles y ropa masculina; su clientela la conforman en su mayoría misceláneas y pequeños puntos comerciales que exhiben los diseños que ella fabrica. Igualmente confecciona sobre medidas y su principal clientela es  el género femenino, quienes le compran de contado y a crédito. Víctor en su taller realiza todo el proceso productivo, desde la compra de materias primas e insumo, diseño, preparación ensamble y acabado de piezas, hasta la comercialización del producto que elabora;  por eso su horario es extendido desde las 8 de la mañana y  son muchas las veces que está por más de 8 horas dedicado a su trabajo. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su taller y lograr adquirir su propia vivienda, por eso se prepara cada día ganando espacios en el mercado, aunque con mucho esfuerzo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e inusmos para elaborar prendas de vestir, pantalones, camisas y vestidos para damas.  Con la inversión de su credikiva logrará elaborar estos productos enfocados en nuevos diseños que trae la moda y que impactarán a su clientela, haciendo que este financiamiento tenga éxito, pues genera a él más oportunidades de ingreso y bienestar y esto es justamente a lo que   Kiva aspira
texts.en:
Victor, 48, has a small clothing shop in his home in the south west of the city. He started his business 12 years ago, when he became unemployed after working as a tailor, where he acquired knowledge of the art of preparing and assembling pieces of clothing. He decided to generate his own income independently. 

Victor's main product lines are dresses for ladies, menswear and children's shirts. His customers are diverse and include small commercial outlets that exhibit the designs that he produces. He also makes garments to measure, and his main clientele are ladies, who buy in cash and credit. 

In his shop, Victor carries out the entire production process from purchasing raw materials and supplies, design, preparation and finishing of pieces, to marketing the finished product, which is why his schedule starts at 8 am and he often works more than 8 hours per day. His goal for the future is to expand his workshop and be able to purchase his own home. Therefore, every day he prepares to gain more ground in the market, albeit with much effort.

Victor is currently applying for his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase raw materials and supplies to  produce clothing, pants, shirts and dresses for ladies. Through the credikiva investment, he will be able to focus on bringing new designs and fashions to his products, which will impact his customers and make this investment a success because it will generate more opportunities to achieve a greater income and quality of life, which is precisely what Kiva aims to do.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies to produce clothing, pants, shirts and dresses for ladies.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 28 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past four years, Joan has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, which sells hair weaves, hair retouch and treatment. 

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair weaves and Movit sprays and pomades, and will help Joan to generate greater profits and help pay for her children's medical bills. Joan hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house on her plot of land. 

Joan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more hair weaves, Movit sprays and pomades

loans.name: Kondokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KONDOKPO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Olarewadjou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Olarewadjou est âgée de 43 ans et vit au Bénin. Olarewadjou est mariée à un certain Tétédé. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre restent à leur charge. Olarewadjou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari, et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Olarewadjou mène comme activité depuis neuf ans, la vente des produits vivriers (farine de blé, sucre et lait) dans son quartier. Olarewadjou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Olarewadjou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KONDOKPO, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les cinq premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Kondokpo Group consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood. This is the sixth time that this group has asked for the financial aid of Alide in order to grow their business.  The representative of the group, named Olarewadjou, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 43 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to Tetede.  The couple have six children, all attending school, of which four remain dependent.  Olarewadjou lives together with her children and her husband. Together with her husband, she takes care of their various household expenses.  In order to meet her needs, Olarewadjou has been in business for nine years, selling food products (wheat flout, sugar, and milk) in her neighborhood.  She stocks up at the Benin market.  In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her revenues and her income, Olarewadjou and the other members of the Kondokpo Group are asking for their sixth Alide loan.  The first five loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacs of wheat flour, boxes of sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 39 years old, married to James, and blessed with four children aged 17, 16, 12 and 10 years. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells a variety of foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in this business for the past 12 years and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. She has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase 10 crates of sodas, packets of cakes and sweets for sale. 


The profit she makes will aid her in adding more stock of new products to her shop. She dreams of owning a chain of businesses such as a supermarket cum M-pesa (money transfer) shop.

loans.use: To purchase 10 crates of sodas, packets of cakes and sweets.

loans.name: Sofia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sofía es una mujer de 40 años, se describe como una persona sencilla, honrada y muy trabajadora. Sofía vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en Atuntaqui que se encuentra cerca de Otavalo.

Sofía trabaja con su esposo en la confección de bordados como: sellos de empresas, escudos de colegios, escudos de la policía, escudos militares y diferentes figuras en hilo. Sofía empezó a trabajar para otras personas, pero pudo capitalizarse y comprarse su propia máquina de bordados y conseguir sus propios clientes. Sofía necesita cubrir un pedido y solicitó un crédito en Fodemi el mismo que será invertido en la compra de  hilos grandes al por mayor de diferentes gamas de colores.

Sofía sueña en que sus hijos sean profesionales, también desea comprar más maquinaria para poder tener su propia fábrica de bordados.
texts.en:
Sofía is a 40 year old woman, described as a simple, honest and hardworking person. Sofía lives with her husband and her three children in Atuntaqui which is located near Otavalo.

Sofía works with her husband in embroidery work, such as: company insignia, school crests, police badges, military badges and various stitched depictions. Sofía began by working for other people, but she was able to save and buy her own embroidery machine and get her own customers. Sofía needs to fulfill an order and she is asking for a loan through Fodemi to be used to buy embroidery thread at wholesale prices in different color ranges.

Sofía dreams of her children becoming professionals, and also she wants to buy more machinery in order to be able to have her own embroidery factory.

loans.use: to buy embroidery thread at wholesale prices in different color ranges

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is aged 31 and single and has been in farming for six successive years running his farm with two farmhands engaged on a casual basis. His farm produces maize, vegetables, milk and poultry products.

Charles has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry business by buying more birds. He plans to run a farm of at least 500 in the flock. He says good income from farming will help him build a good foundation for a family by owning assets.

He adds his growth is assured with loan acquisition and he would like Juhudi Kilimo to reach out to more farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Adune

texts.en:
Adune is 50 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Adune has been working hard to manage her accessories shop, which sells watches, lipstick, bangles. 

To help expand her business, Adune has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy make-up, hair bows, watches, lip gloss, weaves, etc, and will help Adune to generate greater profits and increase the family income and therefore their standard of living. Adune hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her cosmetic and accessories shop. 

Adune is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Adune who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy make-up, hair bows, watches, lip gloss, weaves, etc

loans.name: Francisco Rafael

texts.es: Francisco de 30 años de dad es el propietario de un café internet, ubicado en su propia residencia en un barrio del sur de la ciudad, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos de 4 año y 9 meses  de nacida. Su negocio tiene 5 años de experiencia y surgió porque como técnico en informática, necesitaba desarrollar una actividad afín que le generara ingresos y con su conocimiento previó que le iría muy bien, como efectivamente ocurrió. En su negocio ofrece servicios de internet, impresiones y llamadas. Su mayor desafío es atender rápidamente a su clientela, pero su impresora es muy lenta para las expectativas del cliente; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una impresora, papelería y tinta en mayor volumen. Con su credikiva espera ofrecer un servicio mas efectivo a su clientela actual  y ganar muchos mas clientes potenciales.  Francisco se esmera diariamente en su labor,  por eso su horario de trabajo es de 12 horas diarias y los domingos y festivos logra extenderlo, pero aun así se siente satisfecho y con muchos sueños de prosperidad personal familiar y empresarial y todo esto se logra con trabajo disciplinado.
texts.en:
30-year-old Francisco owns an internet cafe located in his home in a southern suburb of the city, where he lives with his spouse and their two children aged 4, and 9 months old. He has five years of experience in his business. He is a computer technician and needed to develop a related activity that would generate income. He predicted that his knowledge would fare him very well, which is indeed what happened. 

His business offers internet services, printing and phone calls. His biggest challenge is to respond quickly to his customers, but his printer is too slow to be able to meet customer expectations. This is the reason he applied for a credikiva, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest in the purchase of a printer, and greater volumes of paper and ink. Through the loan, he expects to offer a more effective service to his existing customers and also win many more potential customers. Francisco works hard every day, working 12 hours daily and also on Sundays and holidays, but he still feels satisfied and has many dreams of prosperity for his family and his business, which he accomplishes through his disciplined work.

loans.use: to purchase a printer, and greater volumes of paper and ink.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 5 years, Mohammed has been working hard to manage his clinic, where he treats patients and sells medicine.

To help expand his business, Mohammed has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy panadols, painkillers, injectables, and anti-malarials, and will help Mohammed to generate greater profits and will increase his family's monthly income. Mohammed hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger clinic.

Mohammed is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mohammed who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy panadols, painkillers, injectables, and anti-malarials.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 32 years old and single, and he supports two of his siblings. He supplies tomatoes to the open air market. He started this business 6 years ago and earns a monthly income of 11,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He has requested a first loan of 20,000 KES to purchase additional crates of tomatoes for resale. 

The anticipated profit will help him start farming tomatoes as well as repay his loan. He dreams of seeing his stock and capital increase in order to venture into other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes for resale in the market.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been a farmer in Eldoret, North Rift, Kenya for the past twenty years and currently runs her farm with two farmhands and produces beans, maize, vegetables and poultry products. She runs a milling service shop at the local market for additional income. She is married with five children aged between 18 and 9 years.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.She wants to own at least three dairy cows and venture into sheep farming and possibly buy a pick-up for transporting produce to the market and generate additional income from transport service to other farmers. Elizabeth says farming income will help her feed the family.

She is happy with Juhudi Kilimo services, saying the interest charged is far outweighed by the services like training made available to farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, of whom one is currently in school. For the past four years, Teo has been working hard to manage her bar, where she sells beer and other beverages.

To help expand her business, Teo has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer, soda, and drinks to sell, and will help Teo to generate greater profits and allow her to finish her rental houses. Teo hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a restaurant.

Teo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beer, soda, and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is age 36 and married with one child who is age 12 years and in school. Mary has been in farming for 14 years running and currently produces milk, maize, beans, vegetables, and poultry birds. She runs a retail business in the local market dealing with grocery items.

Mary has made a loan request of 31,200 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She believes this will improve her farming income, which she will then use to expand her retail business and purchase more land.

Mary says the major challenges in farming include substandard input materials and high cost of feeds. She is happy with her Juhudi Kilimo partnership and believes she will be able to meet her family's needs adequately.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona is a mother of three children with the first and second-born being aged 9 and 6 years and the last only three months. She has been in farming for eight years and running the farm with the help of five farmhands on a temporary basis. She does a lumbering business besides farming.

Lona has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She reiterates the dairy loan will boost her farming income and enable her to expand even the lumbering business. Her focus is to buy a truck to help in transporting her farm produce.

She plans to continue working with Juhudi Kilimo to access bigger loans. She however notes the major challenges in farming include counterfeit products of inputs and bad debtors especially with her lumbering business which informs her main focus to make farming her core business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is aged 35 and has been in farming for five consecutive years. She currently employs two farmhands and produces eggs, birds, milk, maize and vegetables for the local market. She is married with three children aged 15, 11 and 4 years. She says farming is her only source of income.

Everlyne has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to venture into cereals retail business which will enable her to get better returns to educate her children. She hopes to eventually run a farm with 1000-bird flock as well.

She notes fluctuation in weather and high cost of inputs like pesticides as the major challenges but is glad about faster loans processing by Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Miladys Dayana

texts.es: Maidy con su anterior credikiva compró materias primas e insumos y se dedicó a la fabricación de Jeanes y suéteres, y en general ropa en tejido de punto, así fue como tuvo capital suficiente para sacar adelante su producción, y responderle efectivamente a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará telas para lograr una nueva producción de 100 jeans para hombres, 20 para niños, y 3000 pantalones. Su inversión será exitosa porque la hace sobre la demanda de su mercado que son los puntos comerciales de ropa, misceláneas y tiendas de ropa. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias a Kiva he logrado cumplir en parte mis objetivos de ampliación, sin embargo esto es apenas el inicio y que bueno que ustedes me estén apoyando”
texts.en: Miladys was able with her previous Kiva loan to buy raw material and supplies in order to make jeans and sweaters, in general knitted fabrics, and this is how she had enough capital to succeed in her production, and meet her customer’s requests. Currently she is asking for a new Kiva loan in order to buy fabrics for a new output of 100 jeans for men, 20 for children and 3000 pants. The investment will be successful because of the demand by the market for commercial clothing, miscellaneous items, and clothing stores. Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: “Thanks to Kiva I have managed to fulfill my expansion goals, however this is scarcely the beginning and how good it is that you are helping me.”

loans.use: to purchase rolls of denim so that she can complete a large order.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet's group is comprised of four hard working women. Annet is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past one year, Annet has been working hard to manage her small business, which does tailoring. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making clothes for resale, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and pay for her own school fees. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to own a training center for tailoring. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes for resale

loans.name: Naum

texts.en:
Naum has been in active farming in her rural home in Eldoret, South Rift, Kenya where she lives with her family of two children aged 8 and 6 years. She has ten years of experience in active farming with her farming producing milk, maize, eggs, beans and vegetables.

Naum has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry farming by buying more poultry birds for 50,000 KES and renovating the current poultry housing unit at a cost of 10,000 KES.She reiterates her asset base will increase and enable her to venture into more farming projects.

Naum appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loans services with reasonable interest charges and training for farmers coupled with efficiency in loan disbursement.

loans.use: To buy more birds and construct a poultry housing unit

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kabwole in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Christopher has been working hard to manage his farm, from which he sells cattle, goats and "matooke" (green plantains). 

To help expand his business, Christopher has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goats and cows, and will help Christopher to generate greater profits and will help him produce more milk, which is an advantage to his family. Christopher hopes that in the future he will be able to expand to do goat rearing on a larger farm. 

Christopher is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christopher who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more goats and cows

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 33 years old, single and lives in the Philippines.

Janeth is selling perfumes in their local community. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to purchase perfumes to re-sell.

Janeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Janeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes to re sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a 44-year-old married woman. She has two children, 15 years and 17 years old. She describes herself to be a focused woman . She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as bananas, oranges, cabbages, ovacados, etc. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located within a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Rachel describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of vegetables and fruits. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for resale. Her business goal is to be a distributor of vegetables and fruits for resale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en: Melodia is  56  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Melodia  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 9  years. She requested a loan for  4,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Melodia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Melodia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Reagan

texts.en:
Reagan is 25 years of age, single and supporting his younger brother. He runs a food stall business that he started two years ago and earns KES 7,500 per month. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 5,000 to purchase  more utensils for use in his business. Profit from his business will be invested back into the business. His dream is to see his business grow bigger as well as to educate his children without struggle.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils for his business.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en:
Muhamad is 31 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Muhamad has been working hard to manage his grocery, where he sells posho (cornmeal), rice, sugar and soap, etc. 

To help expand his business, Muhamad has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy rice, ground-nuts and posho, and will help Muhamad to generate greater profits and help him buy more food like cereals, beans and rice. Muhamad hopes that in the future he will be able to grow his grocery. 

Muhamad is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Muhamad who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy rice, ground-nuts and posho (cornmeal)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy parts and do maintenance on the motorcycle for better and safe  service

loans.name: Magidu

texts.en:
Magidu is 52 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has 15 children with 10 of them currently in school. For the past 32 years, Magidu has been working hard to manage his butcher shop, where he sells goat and cow meat. 

To help expand his business, Magidu has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows and goats, and will help Magidu to generate greater profits to pay school fees and buy another house. Magidu hopes that in the future he will be able to have more branches of his butcher shop. 

Magidu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Magidu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more cows and goats

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past one year, Eric has been working hard to manage his clinic, where he treats patients and sells medicine. 

To help expand his business, Eric has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs like  Panadol, Cough Off, Cloud Cap, etc. and will help Eric to generate greater profits to buy more drugs for the clinic and build an admitting room for patients. Eric hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger and well-stocked clinic. 

Eric is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eric who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more drugs like Panadol, Cough Off, Cloud Cap, etc

loans.name: Gloria Esther

texts.es: Gloria de 52 años de edad es la propietaria de una tienda ubicada en el centro de Malambo, donde habita con su esposo y tiene un hijo de 34 años de edad. Desde hace 5 años empezó su experiencia emprendedora, iniciada por su hijo para genera ingresos suficientes, pues estaba recién egresado de sus estudios y no tenia empleo. Posteriormente   esta actividad la continuó Gloria,  quien ha logrado sostenerla y está empeñada en hacerla crecer mucho más aprovechando su clientela y el punto comercial. En su tienda vende ranchos, víveres, refrescos y en general artículos de la canasta familiar. Gradualmente su clientela pregunta por artículos de miscelánea que aun no tiene y que si ella contara con un capital de  trabajo suficiente, pudiera complacer a su mercado. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un Credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará accesorios femeninos, artículos de cocina, fantasía, papelería en general etc Con su credikiva aprovechara el potencial de clientes que van a comprar a otros establecimientos, teniendo Gloria un punto de venta que les queda a un mas cerca y es en este aspecto en el que radica el éxito de un credikiva.  Gloria es una mujer muy trabajadora ella inicia su jornada de trabajo desde las 6 de la mañana y muchas veces trabaja mas de 12 horas diarias y de lunes a Domingo. Pero muy seguramente pronto encontrará respuesta de prosperidad a todos estos esfuerzos.
texts.en: Gloria, 52, owns a store in Malambo.  She lives there with her husband and a son, 34.  She started her business 5 years ago after taking over a store that her son started to raise money for his studies.  She has grown the business since then and her income from it helps to support her family.  She stocks all the everday products that people in her neighborhood want.  She listens to her customers and stocks new products when she can.  That's where Kiva comes in: Gloria wants to stock new products for her store and needs this Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo loan to fund the investment.  She will buy feminine accessories, kitchenware and other products that her customers have asked her to sell.  Your loan will allow her to keep her customers and also provide her neighborhood with a store nearby that they can easily come to.  Gloria is a hard-working woman.  She starts her day at 6 in the morning and often works 12 hours a day, Mondays to Sundays.  She is confident that all her hard work will pay off one day.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Kresek Indah 3 Group

texts.en: Lisbet has been selling kids' clothes, adult clothes, and nightgowns on credit since 2006.
