She goes around her environment to ask her neighbors whether they need  something but can not buy it with cash. If so, she will help them by providing the items and her customer will pay her on credit. Now, she has a lot of customers. She likes to run this business because she can still have more time at home to take care of her children who are still in school. With her income, she can help her husband to cover their household expenses and have extra income to pay their children's school fees. In the future, she wants to expand her business and have a shop in Ciracas.

loans.use: to buy kids' clothes, adult clothes, and nightgowns

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 54 years old, widowed with children who are all grown-ups. She runs a private school that she started 12 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. She is requesting a second loan of KES 50,000 to purchase desks for the school. 

The profit she earns from this business will contribute towards her buying a piece of land to build more classrooms. She dreams of seeing this school excel to national levels.

loans.use: To purchase desks for her school

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres de nombre San Cayetano está en el primer ciclo, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de cooperación y ayuda mutua.
La Sra. Ana  se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo y es gracias a su trabajo que ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para el día a día. Su meta es poder tener un local grande para seguir ofreciendo sus comidas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, aceite, verduras y demás para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas.
texts.en: The committee of women by the name "San Cayetano" is in its first loan cycle.  All of the group members work in an environment of cooperation and mutual assistance.  Mrs. Ana works selling all types of food and it is thanks to this job that she helps her family and gives them what they need day to day.  Her goal is to be able to have a large shop to be able to continue offering her foods.   She is asking for a loan in order to purchase meat, oil, vegetables, and other things in order to continue making her meals.

loans.use: To purchase meat, oil, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Emiliana tiene 29 años; vive en pareja con el Sr. Bernardo y tienen  dos hijos pequeños por quienes ambos luchan incansablemente.
Ellos se dedican a la confección de prendas de vestir para dama, caballeros y niños, están trabajando en  este campo desde hace 4 años y gracias a eso ya poseen una buena clientela formada y por los pedidos que tienen solicitan este crédito para la compra de telas y de esa forma cumplir con sus pedidos.
Emiliana desea construir para su vivienda ya que viven en casa de su hermano, y quiere poder independizarse.
texts.en: Mrs. Emiliana is 20 years old.  She lives with her partner Mr. Bernardo and they have two small children who both parents work for tirelessly.  They work making clothing for women, men and children.   They have been working in this field for four years and thanks to the work they now have a well-formed clientele.  Because of the requests that they receive they are asking for credit in order to purchase fabrics and in that way complete all of the requests.  Emiliana desires to construct her own home since they live in her brother's house, and she would like to become independent.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Victoriosas  nace mediante la gestión de una de las miembros, quien inspirada en ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas las invito a formar un grupo.
La Sra. Hilda, es parte del grupo, es casada tiene 36 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y por sobre todo muy optimista e inculca a las integrantes de su comité a salir adelante. Ella se dedica a las ventas varias y solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, fideos, carne, leche, panificaos, arroz, etc, con lo cual podrá surtirse y ayudar a su familia con su negocio.
texts.en: The committee "Mujeres Victoriosas" or "Victorious Women" was born out of the efforts of one of the group members, who was inspired to help her friends and neighbors and invited them to form a group. Mrs. Hilda is part of the group.  She is married and is 36 years old.  She is a motivated, hard-working woman, and above all is very optimistic and teaches the group members how to get ahead.  She works in various kinds of sales and is asking for credit to purchase sugar, pasta, meat, milk, bread, rice, etc., with which she will increase her supplies and help her family via the business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, pasta, meat, milk, breads and rice.

loans.name: Blanca Elena

texts.es: Blanca de 42 años de edad es la propietaria de una microempresa donde vende cocteles de frutas llamados cholaos, un producto típico del Departamento del Valle del Cauca, el cual se prepara con granizado de hielo, frutas tropicales picadas, crema de leche, leche condensada y maní. Ella ha logrado crecer gradualmente y tiene 3 puntos de ventas de este delicioso refresco, que mucho gusta a la clientela de Barranquilla, ciudad de brisa, sol y mucha alegría en su cálida gente, como el clima, a quienes con el rico cholao refresca   Blanca.    En su negocio Blanca es apoyada por sus tres hijos en las edades de 17 a 22 años, con ellos sueña, que sean muy exitosos en lo que emprendan. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará crema de leche en mayor volumen, una licuadora, vajillas y recipientes de cristal donde poder conservar las frutas de manera adecuada. Su meta mas adelante es agregar jugos naturales de frutas tropicales que crecen en esta tierra de manera muy natural y su gran desafío es lograr dar a conocer en varios lugares de la ciudad el exquisito producto refrescante.
texts.en: Blanca, 42, operates a small food business, making and selling "cholaos", a kind of fruit cocktail popular in the Cauca Valley region, that she makes with crushed ice, tropical fruits, cream, condensed milk and peanuts.  She has slowly grown the business over several years and now has 3 food stalls in Barranquilla, a city known for soft breezes, sun and a people as warm as the region's climate.  Blanca's three children, who range in age from 17- to 22-years old, have helped her make the business a success.  Blanca is applying to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--milk, a blender, tableware and glass containers--to operate her business.  For the future, she tells us that she wants to add fruit juices to her menu.  She can make the juices from tropical fruits that are native to this area.  Her biggest challenge, she says, is growing her business to parts of the city where she's not now known.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 44 years old, married with six children aged between one and 23 years old. He is in the livestock trading business and has been in operation for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 3,000. This is his second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, after completing his first loan. 

He will use the loan to purchase sheeps and goats for resale. He plans to use the profits gained on running his livestock business and some amount in the upkeep of his family. 

His hopes and dreams are that his livestock trading business prospers and his family’s living standards improve.

loans.use: To purchase more sheeps and goats for resale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 48 years old and married to Emily. The couple is blessed with six children between the ages of five and 19 and they jointly provide for their family. For the past 14 years, Julius has been selling cereals and earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. 

Julius is requesting a 25,000 KES loan through KADET LTD to pay university fees for his child. This is his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan. His dreams and hopes are that his children are educated well for a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay university fees for his child

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina  is a widowed woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 18 years to 30 years old. She works hard to support her family as she is the sole provider of the family. She describes herself to be a patient and obedient woman. She operates a retail store where she sells used clothing. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located at a viable business environment  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of second-hand clothes. 

Regina will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more second-hand clothes for selling. Her business goal is to increase the volume of clothes for resale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Veronica Giovanna

texts.es: Verónica es separada con 03 hijos mayores de edad.  A sus 41 años Verónica a logrado cumplir algunos de sus metas como el de construir parte de su vivienda y apoyar en la educación a sus hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y productos de belleza, la cual trabaja a pedidos, siendo la gran mayoría de sus clientes vecinos y familiares. Verónica es buena para los negocio muestra de ello es que cada vez aumentan sus clientes. Se siente feliz pues  gracias a su negocio puede seguir apoyando a una de sus nietas. Más adelante piensa poner un bazar, donde pueda  exhibir sus productos.    Su último crédito lo destinara para la compra de ropas de temporada y productos de belleza y así tener un stock guardado. Verónica agradece  a los prestamistas Kiva por hacer posible su progreso.
texts.en: Veronica, 41, is separated with 3 grown children.  She has met many of her goals in life, from building a house to educating her children.  Now she wants to build her clothing and beauty products business.  She sells her merchandise to order and tells us that her customers are mostly kin or neighbors.  Veronica is well-suited to this kind of business and says that she is adding new customers by the day.  She adds that she is happy with the business and that the income from it allows her to help her granddaughters.  For the future, she would like to open a store where she can meet her customers.  She will use this loan to stock her business with beauty products and seasonal clothing.  Veronica wants you to know that she is grateful to you for supporting her future.

loans.use: to stock her clothing business.

loans.name: Madina's Group

texts.en:
Madina is 21 years old and married with two children. She lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past year, Madina has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells essential commodities such as dry beans, sugar, and maize flour. Her loan group is comprised of three hardworking women. 

Madina is requesting a 6,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to expand her business and buy more essential commodities such as maize flour, dry beans, and sugar to sell. Her loan will help her generate greater profits that she will use to expand her business. In the future, Madina hopes to own a wholesale shop. 

Madina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has improved Madina's future prospects.

loans.use: to buy commodities such as maize flour, beans, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Agya

texts.en: Agya is a carpenter at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina. Agya has received no formal education. He is married and has one child. His wife is a baker. Agya has been in carpentry for 25 years. He is responsible for feeding and clothing his child. His loan will be used to buy wood, tools, and other supplies. He hopes to use the new profits to support his family and continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy wood, tools, and other supplies

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.en:
Kobiljon is very clever boy who is trying to realize his dream of becoming a successful financier. With this goal, he entered the Polytechnic University and finished the year successfully. Kobiljon is an excellent student with good marks. He also enjoys sports and likes to play football after classes. Kobiljon works as volunteer at the local television company and has good work skills. His parents are workers and do not have enough money for him to continue at university. 

Kobiljon is requesting a 1,175 USD loan to pay for his university studies. Please, help him realize his dream. Kobiljon awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for university studies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a farmer in Eldoret where she resides in her rural home with her husband and two children aged 7 and 1 year old. She has been in farming for twelve successive years with her major produce being maize, milk, eggs and vegetables. She runs a cereals retail business besides farming.

Rose has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy. She plans to buy more land to enable her to plant at least ten acres of maize every planting season to boost her cereals business. She currently sources some cereals from local middlemen who charge exorbitant prices.
 
She laments of the high costs of inputs, especially during dry seasons, and unstable prices for farm produce in the local markets.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 36 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with two of them currently in school. For over 10 years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his brick making business where he makes bricks and sells them. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand his business by purchasing more bricks, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and improve his business by allowing him to sell more bricks. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to grow his business beyond brick-making. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: expand his business by purchasing more bricks

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 45 years old is married with six children, four of whom are currently in school. He lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. For the past 12 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his farm and garden shop where he sells seedlings. 

Francis is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to help expand his business and buy more flowers, seedlings, trees, and fruit plants. His loan will help him to generate greater profits and boost his business by allowing him to sell more. Francis hopes that in the future, he will be able to have a larger farm and improve his standard of living. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy flowers, seedlings, trees, and fruit plants to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is divorced and has four children. She has received schooling through middle school. Maame is a seamstress but also sells 'kenkey' (cooked then fermented maize and cassava dough) at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina, which she has done for  18 years. Maame uses her income to pay for feeding and clothing her children as well as paying their school fees. Maame will use the loan to purchase more maize. With the new profits, Maame plans to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more maize

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells bean stew and 'gari' (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina. Adjoa has received no formal education.  She is married and has eight children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more 'gari' from the processor as well as beans for her stew. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy more beans and 'gari'

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 51-year-old widow who supports her two children. For the past two years, she has sold fruit and she earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

Beatrice is requesting a loan of 22,000 KES to pay school fees for her two sons in high school This is her second loan. In the future, Beatrice hopes to educate her children through the university level.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her two children

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is married and has one child. She never went to school. Araba sells kenkey (fermented maize dough) and fried fish in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina, which she has done for 40 years. In the picture, she is putting her fish on the burner to fry. Her husband is a farmer. Araba uses her income to help pay her grandchildren's school fees. Araba will use the loan to purchase maize and fish in bulk. With the new profits, Araba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize and fish in bulk

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Maame sells cooked yam at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina, which she has done for 4 years. Her husband is a fisherman. Maame uses her income to pay for her children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase more yams in bulk. With the new profits, Maame plans to continue to expand her business .

loans.use: to purchase more yams in bulk

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 30 years old, married and blessed with three children that he supports. He has been running a retail shop for the last 4 years getting a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Paul has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. He plans to restock his shop with a variety of petroleum jelly products. The anticipated profits will be ploughed back to business for expansion. His future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to restock his shop with a variety of petroleum jelly products.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a fishmonger at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina. Aba has received schooling through middle school. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Aba has been a fishmonger for 15 years. She is responsible for paying her grandchildren's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Tculie

texts.en:
Tculie is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past two years, Tculie has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Tculie has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair extensions for the salon, and will help Tculie to generate greater profits and pay for the house rent. Tculie hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big restaurant. 

Tculie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has improved Tculie's future prospects.

loans.use: to buy more hair extensions for the salon

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is widow with three children. For the past 40 years, she has worked as a farmer and fish monger in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina. Ama received no formal education and she uses her income to help pay for her grandchildren's school fees as well as to take care of herself. 

Ama is requesting a loan to purchase fish in bulk. She plans to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
El señor Cecilio,  vive en la comunidad de tin tin de la  provincia de mizque del departamento de cochabamba,  tiene dos hijos dependiente, Cecilio  se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, en la anterior cosecha hubo  desastre natural de sequía y sus cultivos bajaron de rendimiento por la falta de agua, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos a toda su familia que se mantenían con la producción agrícola. Cada año producen solo producen mani, frejol  en su pequeña parcela. 
Cecilio es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicado a toda su familia  y su trabajo que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a sus pequeño hijos, el  está solicitando el crédito para comprar mas semilla de mani, abono organico y de esta forma mejorara la calidad y el rendimiento de sus cultivos, trabaja en su pequeña parcela que tiene en el lugar donde vive  para mejorar sus ingreso económico y  darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y que ellos  puedan asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a toda su familia y al duro  trabajo que realizan todos.
texts.en:
Sr. Cecilio lives in the community of Tin Tin in Mizque Province in Cochabamba Department. He has two dependent children. He is a farmer and a natural disaster, drought, affected his previous harvest so that his crop yields dropped for lack of water. This caused his income to fall and affected his family, which he supports through his agricultural production. He produces only peanuts and beans on his small plot every year.

Cecilio is a person who is very much loved and respected in his community because of his dedication to his family and for his work. At times he even has to do day labor on farms in order to earn some pesos and thereby support his young children. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more peanut seeds and organic fertilizer so that he can improve the quality and yield of his crops. He farms the small plot he has in the place he lives so he can improve his income and provide a better quality of life for his children and they can attend school in a better situation. The loan will help his entire family greatly in the hard work they all do.

loans.use: to purchase peanut seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married with one child. Her husband is a carpenter and Esi received schooling through junior high school. For the past eight years, she has been selling kenkey (fermented maize and cassava dough) at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina. Esi is responsible for paying for her child's school fees. 

Esi is requesting a loan to buy more maize to increase her kenkey production. She hopes to use her profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more maize

loans.name: Jessenia Del Socorro

texts.es: Jessenia está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas y está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios y así poder optar a su título. Su sueño es ser una ingeniera titulada para adquirir una profesión y brindar servicios. Sus padres siempre le han dado su apoyo en lo que respecta a estudios y su meta es no defraudarlos y llegar a convertirse en una profesional.
texts.en: Jessenia is studying engineering systems and is asking for a loan to pay for her final course of study and thus become eligible to be granted her degree. Her dream is to be a licensed engineer in order to have a profession and provide services. Her parents have always given their support in regards to her studies and her goal is to not let them down and to become a professional.

loans.use: to pay for her final course in order to receive her degree

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano" surgió gracias a promociones hechas en la zona, actualmente están en 3º ciclo del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras, está integrada por 11 señoras muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
Anuncia es una de las miembros, quien se dedica a las ventas, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, donde atiende y surte a sus clientes y vecinos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, lácteos, carnes, y demás insumos, con los que podrá seguir surtiendo a sus vecinos y clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group "San Cayetano" arose thanks to promotions made in the area. Currently they are in their third loan cycle in the program 'Committee for Enterprising Women.' It is made up of eleven very hardworking and enterprising women.

Anuncia is one of the members who works in sales. She has a well-stocked pantry where she works and supplies her customers and neighbors. She is asking for the loan to buy vegetables, dairy products, meat, and other provisions, with which she will be able to continue supplying her neighbors and customers. 

She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, dairy products, meat, and other provisions.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is 22 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past one year, Hasifa has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale, and will help Hasifa to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Hasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to build a residential house. 

Hasifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hasifa's future prospects.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia, tiene 29 años de edad, es de una familia humilde y de escasos recursos económicos, por lo tanto cultiva superficies muy pequeñas, vive en la comunidad de Tako Tako Alto del municipio de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 20 años, produce; papa, frejol y cebolla, especialmente para la alimentación de su familia, el excedente comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. La señora Virginia es una persona muy conocida en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. La señora Virginia, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semillas de papa, frejol, cebolla, abonos y agroquímicos; para mejorar la calidad y aumentar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar la condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Virginia, 29, is from a humble family with few economic resources.  They have small parcels of land and live in Tako Tako Alto, Mizque town, Cochabamba province.  She has worked in farming for 20 years.  She grows potatoes, beans, and onions, especially to feed her family.  She sells the extra food to merchants in Mizque where she lives.  Virginia is a well-known person in her community for her dedication to work and for being responsible for feeding and educating her children. Virginia is requesting the current loan to buy more potato seeds, beans, onions, fertilizer and agrochemicals to improve the quality and to increase the production of her crops.  This way she will have more earnings and better the living conditions for all of her family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, beans, onions, fertilizer and agrochemicals

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 61 years old and is married with four children. For the past three years, she has been a charcoal dealer in Mariakani, buying and selling charcoal to local residents. Her business is doing great. 

Christina is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to purchase more sacks of charcoal. She will use the proceeds of her loan to educate her children and repay her loan. Christina hopes to have a more profitable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has two children. She has received no formal education. Ekua sells tomatoes, oranges and other foodstuffs in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina, which she has done for the past 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income for paying her children's school fees. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase tomatoes in bulk. With the new profits, Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Habel

texts.en:
Habel is 32 years old and is married to Faith. The couple has a nine-month-old child. Habel has a profitable business rearing dairy cows and he also has a quarry business.

Habel is requesting a loan to buy another dairy cow. This will be his second loan. He plans to use the profits from his loan to buy a plot of land. In the future, Habel hopes to expand his farm and increase his income to be able to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alba Aurora

texts.es: Alba actualmente está cursando la carrera de Psicología, está por finalizar sus estudios y solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación. Tiene una pequeña hija por la cual ha puesto todo el empeño para salir adelante, le encanta trabajar con niños y es por eso que escogió esta carrera. Un desafío que tuvo que vencer fue el de estudiar, trabajar y cuidar a su hija al mismo tiempo. Es una persona responsable y que dia a dia lucha por salir adelante.
texts.en: Alba is studying for a degree in psychology.  She is applying for a loan that she use to pay her tuition fees.  She has a young daughter and is working hard to create a better life for herself and her child.  She chose a career in psychology because she likes working with children.  Her biggest challenge is finding time enough to study, work and care for her daughter.  Alba is a responsible woman who fights every day to inch ahead.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret   is widowed with eight children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of poultry farming and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO   to buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks.  

Besides poultry farming business Margaret generates additional income from rental rooms.    She works from her home and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis and works seven days a week.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of bags of chicken feed from the market to her home. 

Margaret is aspiring of owning 4000 laying chickens and also building more rental houses.  She resides in her   own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of  chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has 7 children. She has received no formal education. Esi  sells foodstuffs such as tomatoes and cooking oil at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina, which she has done for 5 years. Her husband operates a drinking spot (bar). Esi uses her income to pay for her children's school fees. Esi will use the loan to purchase more items to sell such as fish and onions. With the new profits, Esi plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell,  such as fish and onions

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells 'kenkey' (cooked then fermented maize and cassava dough) at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina. Esi has received no formal education.  She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a fisherman. Esi has been selling kenkey for four years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more maize. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy more maize

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en: Nana Ekua is a farmer and also sells kenkey (fermented maize dough) in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina. Nana Ekua has received no formal education.  She is single and has five children. She has been in these businesses for the past 30 years now. She is responsible for taking care of her family though paying school fees and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy maize in bulk for the production of kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to buy maize in bulk for the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is young and purposeful girl. She graduated from school and decided to organize her own business as her parents work in a collective farm and can’t provide a good quality of life. She is not married and has not no children. She is going to organize a business selling dried fruits. With this aim she studied at the course ‘To get success’  by a women's organization of her native town. She learnt some skills about business. She will be one of the best business women as she is very smart and industrious. 

Gulbahor is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy dried fruits for organization of a new business.  In this way she will be able to offer her customers high quality goods and begin to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for organization of a new business

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is married and has five children. She has received no formal education. Nana sells provisions such as tomatoes, onions, and garden eggs (a type of eggplant) at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina, which she has done for  two years. Her husband is a farmer. Nana uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase more provisions. With the new profits, Nana plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions

loans.name: Moneer

texts.en:
Moneer is 50 years old  and comes from Gaza. He is married and has six children; five of them are at school. He has owned a grocery store since 2009, and has one employee who helps him.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy refrigerators and change the decoration of the store. he hopes that the sales will increase and his income will improve which will help him achieve his ambition in ensuring his family the best financial and health stability.

loans.use: to buy refrigerators and change the decoration of the store

loans.name: Sanije

texts.en:
Sanije is 54 years old and an Ashkali woman from the vulnerable ethnic minority community. She is married and has six children. They all live in a small village under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions.

Sanije’s family owns a small old house, and it has not had any repairs or renovation in the past several years. Her house has a heat-loss problem; every winter it costs a lot of money to buy the coal to keep this house warm. During the winter, her house becomes very cold, and her children always get sick due to the cold.  

It is very beneficial for her family to live comfortably and to stay warm at home.

For the first time, she requests a loan to buy windows and doors for her house repair. After repairing the house Sanije will be able to create better living conditions for the family.

Sanije appreciate KosInvest/Kiva for the help.

loans.use: To buy windows and doors for her house repair.

loans.name: Amour De Dieu Group

texts.fr: « AMOUR DE DIEU » est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Séverine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans. Séverine est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Félix. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Séverine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Séverine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Séverine mène comme activité la vente de charbons de bois et du pétrole à son domicile. Séverine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Séverine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe « AMOUR DE DIEU » un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
"AMOUR DE DIEU" is a group composed of four persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Séverine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 36 years old. She is married to a driver named Felix. They have three children, not all in school but all in their care. Séverine lives together with  her children and husband and jointly ensures along with her husband that the household expenses are covered. 

Séverine did not attend school. To cope with her different expenses, she has been selling charcoal and kerosene out of her home. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

To respond further to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and to make more profit, Séverine, along with the other members of the group "AMOUR DE DIEU", is requesting a fifth  loan from ALIDé. The first four loan were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and kerosene

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is single and has three children. She has a basic education (primary school). She is a petty trader in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina, which she has done for the past 10 years. Araba uses her income to pay her children's school fees and to pay for other household expenses such as utility bills, etc. 

Araba will use the loan to purchase a variety of goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Massavo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MASSAVO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la septième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Philomène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Philomène est âgée de 42 ans et est une veuve. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Philomène est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à sa charge. Philomène vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule ses différents besoins et ceux de son enfant. Pour parvenir aux différents besoins de la famille, Philomène vend depuis quinze ans des boules de pâtes (faites à base de l’amidon du maïs) à son domicile. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins ainsi qu’à ceux de son enfant. Philomène s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Philomène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MASSAVO, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les six premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MASSAVO comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the seventh time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Philomène, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 42 years old and a widow.

Philomène did not attend school. She is the mother of two children, both in school. One of the children is still in her care. Philomène lives alone with her child and makes sure the different family needs are met. Philomène has been selling "boules de pâtes" (made from corn starch) for about fifteen years out of her home. This business enables her to respond without much difficulty to her needs, as well as those of her child. Philomène gets her supplies from a city in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her sales and revenues, Philomène, along with the other members of the group MASSAVO, is requesting a seventh loan from ALIDé. The first six loan were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province. He is married and has one child. He owns a retail shop selling car spare parts; the business has been operating for eleven years. Apart from this, he gets his income from a mobile money transfer shop that he owns.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of his businesses. The challenges he is facing are price fluctuation and inflation and finding spare parts.

Nickson is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenya shillings to expand the mobile money business, i.e., increase the till/float. His extra income from the loan will be added to savings to pay school fees and improve the living standards of his family. His future plans are to expand the business and employ more workers.

loans.use: To expand his mobile money transfer business, i.e., increase the till/float.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is divorced and has four children. She has received schooling through Junior High School. Adjoa sells fruits and vegetables in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina, which she has done for eight years now. With her income, Adjoa takes care of her children through paying school fees and other expenses. She will use the loan to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to invest in her children's educations.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has four children. She has received schooling through Senior High School. Adjoa sells 'waakye' (a traditional dish made from rice and beans) in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina, which she has done for the past three years. Her husband is a driver. Adjoa uses her income for paying her children's school fees. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase raw rice and beans in bulk. With the new profits, Adjoa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw rice and beans in bulk

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has six children. She has received no formal education. Efua has been a fishmonger at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina for 30 years. Her husband is a fisherman. Efua uses her income to pay her grandchildren's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase more fish. With the new profits, Efua plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has five children. She has received a basic education (primary school). Ekua sells doughnuts in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina, which she has done for ten years now. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income to pay her children's school fees. Ekua will use the loan to purchase eggs, sugar, and flour for cooking her doughnuts. With the new profits, Ekua plans to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, sugar, and flour for cooking her doughnuts

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has five children. She has received no formal education. Efua sells 'banku' (cooked then fermented maize and cassava dough) at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a fisherman. Efua uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase more maize so she can increase her 'banku' production. With the new profits, Efua plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more maize

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is divorced and has two children. She has received no formal education. Esi bakes bread and other items in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina, which she has done for 25 years now. She uses her income to pay for her children's school fees as well as all other expenses such as food, clothing and utility bills. Esi will use the loan to purchase eggs, sugar, and flour for baking. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to continue to support her family and herself.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, sugar, and flour for baking

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married with three children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

Milly has a beauty salon. She doesn’t have any side business. She serves all categories of people. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. Her major business challenges include seasonal fluctuations and the increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She is hoping to see her business grow big so that she can own a fully stocked beauty salon and also build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 44 years old married and blessed with children. She has been selling bananas for the last 13 years and earns a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She has requested a second loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more bananas for sale. 

The profit she earns will help her add more stock to her business. She hopes to do well in this business.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old and married with two children. She has been running a cereals business for the last twenty-five years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,800.

She has applied for her second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which she plan to use to purchase more stock of maize, beans and peas for sale. 


The anticipated profits will be invested back into her business. Her future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize, beans, and peas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, and cereals.

loans.name: Bridged

texts.en:
Bridged is 26 years old, married to Nebert, and blessed with three children aged nine, seven, and two years old. She runs a retail shop where she sells motor vehicle spare parts and bicycle spare parts. She started this business eight years ago and earns a monthly of KES 40,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 60,000 to purchase spare parts for vehicles, motorbikes and bicycles for sale. 


Profit made will aid her to repay her loan and she will save the remaining amount for future use. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for vehicles, motorbikes and bicycles for sale.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Rashid has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, flour, rice and soap, etc. 

To help expand his business, Rashid has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soap, salt, sugar and flour to sell in the shop, and will help Rashid to generate greater profits and improve their income and pay his children's school fees. Rashid hopes that in the future he will be able to construct a house in town. 

Rashid is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rashid who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more soap, salt, sugar and flour to sell in his shop

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSIMIDE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier famille. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bernadette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bernadette est âgée de 60 ans et vit au Bénin. Bernadette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Bernadette est mariée à un forgeron du nom de Zamba. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Bernadette vit seule avec son enfant et assure ensemble avec son mari, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Bernadette vend depuis vingt ans, des cropottes dans un marché du Bénin. Bernadette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Bernadette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra certainement à hausser le niveau de leurs activités et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The group MISSIMIDE consists of three members who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Bernadette, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Bernadette, age 60, lives in Benin. She never attended school. She is married to a blacksmith named Zamba. The couple have six children who have all received schooling. One of the children is still in their care. Bernadette lives with her child, and she handles the various household responsibilities together with her husband. 

To that end, Bernadette has been selling cropottes at a market of Benin for 20 years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and to bolster her sales and revenue, Bernadette is seeking a loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group MISSIMIDE. This loan will help to strengthen their activity and boost their profits.

loans.use: to buy cropottes for resale.

loans.name: Tronsi Léa's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDOKPO est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Tronsi Léa est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Tronsi Léa est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Tronsi Léa a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Tronsi Léa est mariée à un certain Florent. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Tronsi Léa vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari, et assure ensemble avec son mari, les charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Tronsi Léa vend, des savons dans une ville du Bénin. Tronsi Léa s’approvisionne à Lomé. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Tronsi Léa sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra certainement à hausser le niveau de leurs activités et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The group GBEDOKPO comprises three persons who are friends. The group's representative, Tronsi Léa, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 32 years old and lives in Benin. Tronsi Léa dropped out of secondary school. She is married to a man named Florent. They have two  children, both in school and in their care. Tronsi Léa lives together with her children and husband and ensures along with her husband that household expenses are covered. 

To make sure the diverse family expenses are covered, Tronsi Léa has been selling soaps in a city in Benin. She gets her supplies from Lomé. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her sales and revenues, Tronsi Léa, along with the other members of the group GBEDOKPO, is requesting an initial loan from ALIDé. This loan will surely enable them to raise their level of business and to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 36 years old and widowed with five children who are in school. The children are aged 15, 13, 11, eight and six years respectively. She runs a grocery stall, a business she started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She is requesting a second loan of KES 20,000 to purchase fruit, beans and potatoes for sale. The profit she earns from this business will aid her in paying school fees and other home expenses.

She dreams of seeing her children reach higher levels of education.

loans.use: To purchase fruit, beans and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman. She has a child.  Irene describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a retail store and a farm where she sells items such as sugar, salt and maize. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are local residents. 

Irene describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area and lack of crops sprouting sometimes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more household items for resale. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have restocked her retail store.

loans.use: to buy household items for her retail store.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es una persona joven trabajadora,  tiene 20  años de edad, viven en la comunidad de san pedro  de la  provincia de mizque del departamento de cochabamba,   tiene un hijos, el padre de su hijo les dejo a causa de un accidente, ahora  ella sola tiene que mantener y alimentarlo  a su pequeño hijo.
Esta época por el desastre natural de la sequía su pequeña parcela de cebolla no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que ella esperaba. 
      Mariela  es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada a su hijo  y su trabajo que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a su hijo, ella está solicitando el crédito para compra semilla de zahoria,  semilla de frejol, abono químico,  abono orgánico y agroquímicos. Para producir más y de esta manera aumentar su producción para mejorar sus ingreso económico y  darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y pueda asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a su hijo y a ella en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Mariela is a hardworking young woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of San Pedro in Mizque Province in Cochabamba Department. She has a child , however the father left them because of an accident. Now she alone supports and feeds her young child.

This season, due to a natural drought disaster, her small parcel of onions did not mature well. The disaster caused the income she was expecting to drop. 

Mariela is a very loved and respected person in her community because of her dedication to her child and her work. At times she even has to hire out as a farm day laborer to earn a little money and thus support her child.  She is requesting a loan to buy carrot seeds, bean seeds, chemical and organic fertilizer and agrochemicals in order to produce more and thereby increase production. This will improve her earnings and insure her child a better quality of life and the ability to attend school in a better situation. The loan will greatly help her child and her in the hard work she does.

loans.use: to purchase carrot seeds and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells maize in Brenu Auyinim near Elmina. Aba has received schooling through middle school. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Aba has been selling maize and other foodstuffs for 25 years. She is responsible for paying her grandchildren's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more maize in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more maize in bulk.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is divorced and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Nana sells waakye (beans and rice cooked together) at Brenu Auyinim near Elmina, which she has done for 30 years. Nana uses her income to pay for taking care of her children. Nana will use the loan to purchase more rice and beans. With the new profits, Nana plans to continue to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. Adjoa sells fishing nets in Brenu Auyinim near Elmina. She has done this for 20 years. Her husband is a fisherman. Adjoa uses her income to take care of her children. She will use the loan to purchase more nets to sell. With the new profits, Adjoa plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing nets to sell

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 23-year-old single man. He describes himself to be social man. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, salt, sodas, bread, flour, etc. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located within a town. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes) loan to buy household items for resale. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a happy family where he will educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more household items for resale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El señor Edwin, tiene 20 años de edad es de una familia humilde y de escasos recursos económicos y por lo tanto cultiva superficies muy pequeñas, vive en la comunidad de Sauces, del municipio de Mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria vende sus productos desde hace cinco años produce papa, frejol y cebolla; los comercializa en el lugar donde vive, a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. El señor Edwin es una persona muy respetado en su comunidad por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la educación  de sus hermanos menores y el bienestar de su familia, juntamente con su madre. El señor Edwin está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semillas de papa, frejol, cebolla, abono químico, abono orgánico y agroquímicos; y de esta forma aumentar y mejorar la calidad de su producción y por lo tanto tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 20 years old and comes from a humble family with limited economic resources.  He cultivates small plots of land, and he lives in the town of Sauces which is in the Mizque municipality in the department of Cochabamba.  He works in agriculture and livestock, and for five years he has grown potatoes, beans, and onions.  He sells his products to the businesses of Mizque where he lives.  

Edwin is very respected in his community for his dedication to his work and, along with his mother, for being responsible for the education of his younger siblings and the well-being of his family.  He is asking for the loan to buy more potato, bean, and onion seeds, as well as chemical and organic fertilizer and agrochemicals.  This is how he hopes to increase and to better the quality of his yield, thus allowing him to have more income and to better the living conditions of his whole family.

loans.use: to buy potato, bean, and onion seeds, chemical fertilizer, and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es: La Señora Cresencia tiene 38 años de edad estado civil soltera tiene 3 hijos menores dependientes vive y trabaja en una comunidad rural 1er Toncoli a 53 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura produce papa, papaliza en terreno de 1,5 has herencia de sus padres, para ella es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos para un préstamo de dinero y les piden muchos requisitos, doña Cresencia necesita capital para comprar insumos agrícolas (abono orgánico y semilla de papa) para ampliar sus cultivos y aumentar la producción agrícola en la siguiente campaña agrícola, doña Cresencia nos comenta con el ahorro que tenía compro un lote de terreno para vivienda, sembrando otra vez empezara a ahorrar para construir su casa propia y sacar adelante a sus hijos, porque actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Señora Cresencia is 38 years old, single, and has three young dependent children.  She lives and works in the first rural community of Toncoli which is 53 km from the city of Cochabamba. For 20 years she has made a living through agriculture, producing papalisa potatoes (a type of potato common in Bolivia) on the 1.5 hectares of land she inherited from her parents.  

For her it is very difficult to go to the banks for a money loan and they ask for many requirements.  Doña Cresencia needs money to buy agricultural materials (organic fertilizer and potato seed) in order to increase her crops and increase her agricultural production in the next agricultural season.  Doña Cresencia said that with the savings she had she bought a piece of land for her residence, planting again to begin to save in order to build her own home and to get her children ahead in life, because currently she lives in her parents' house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials.

loans.name: Fatoumata Bintou

texts.fr: Mme Fatoumata Bintou habite à quelques pas de l’institution, divorcée et mère de 3 enfants, elle a en charge en plus de ses enfants 2 autres personnes .Mme Fatoumata évolue dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans, elle achète des produits alimentaires comme du lait, des cornes bœufs, ananas tranches, des dattes venant tous de la Mauritanie. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 pour acheter  plus de produits alimentaires pour augmenter ses revenus, avec les bénéfices qu’elle aura  elle pourra en épargner et satisfaire les besoins quotidiennes de la famille. Mme Fatoumata a comme ambition d’avoir une grande boutique d’alimentation.
texts.en: Mrs. Fatoumata Bintou lives within walking distance from our office. She is divorced, with three children. In addition to her own children, she has two other dependents. For over 10 years, Mrs. Fatoumata has been in commerce: she buys food products such as milk, corned beef, sliced pineapples and dates. Her products come from Mauritania. She is seeking a credit of 250,000 [West African Francs] in order to buy more food products and increase her revenues. She plans to use her  income to put money away as savings and provide for everyday family needs. Her goal is to open a large  grocery store.

loans.use: to buy food products from Mauritania in order to resell them in front of her house, where she has her  stand.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is married and has two children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Maame operates a provisions store and sells cloth/fabric in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina, which she has done for the past three years. Her husband is a teacher. Maame uses her income to pay her children's school fees. Maame will use the loan to purchase a wider variety of provisions such as Milo (a brand of malted milk), milk, and eggs. With the new profits, Maame plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of provisions such as Milo, milk, and eggs.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial los cultivos de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos de su barrio, pero la mayoría de las veces le gusta pasar momentos de familia con sus 2 pequeños de 5 y 2 años, a quienes adora y quiere mucho ya que él desea que sean mejores que él y sobre todo porque quiere darle una vida digna. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Jose trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, ya que con el fruto de esta trabajo el puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, él le dedica a su labor alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes diariamente; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque siempre trabaja con mucho ánimo.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatar5ios Kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, como reforzamiento de techo ya que este es de esteras y caña y comprara planchas de eternit para poder cubrirlo; con ello tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa de material noble y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Jose is a 21 year old young man who lives in the city of Ica.  The city is known for its warm and welcoming climate.  Farming takes place in the city, especially cotton, grapes, and asparagus crops, among others, are cultivated.  

When he has free time he likes to play soccer with his friends in the neighborhood.  However, most of the time he likes to spend time with his family.  He has two little ones, ages five and two.  He adores and loves them a lot.  He wishes for them to be better than he is.  Most of all he wants to give them a decent life.

Due to his small amount of financial resources, he only went to high school.  However, he would have liked to have had a university education.

Jose works day to day as a “mototaxi” [three wheeled motorized vehicle] driver.  With the fruit of his work he is able to pay the household expenses.  He works around 10 hours a day, and he can provide service for up to 40 customers daily.  He believes that it is going well for him in his business because he is nice to his customers.  Mostly it is because he always works with good cheer.

Jose is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given him he will be able to make improvements to his home.  He will reinforce the roof because it is made of mats and reeds.  He will buy roofing sheets in order to be able to cover it.  With that he will have a better quality of life.  He will be able to continue working in order to make his biggest dream come true:  “To have a house made of solid material and to give his children a good education.”

loans.use: to improve his house.

loans.name: Julia Bacilia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su amado esposo y su pequeña hija de 7 años, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; desde muy joven Julia ha trabajado para apoyar a sus padres y hermanos, por tal motivo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo; en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su esposo, desde hace 2 años Julia puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de tortas, desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia la preparación de las tortas, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor ya que sus clientes la buscan por su trato amable y buena sazón. 
Julia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño horno, quequeras, fuentes y algunos insumos; de esta manera Julia contará con los materiales e insumos necesarios para su negocio, así ella espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano desea utilizar para poder construir su vivienda con materiales adecuados, ya que actualmente su vivienda es de triplay, plásticos, estera, plásticos y cartones, con ello espera poder asegurar el bienestar y futuro de su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Julia, 48, lives in Cañete, Imperial District with her beloved husband and her 7-year-old daughter. Julia is a friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic person who works tirelessly with her husband to sustain their family. As a child, she worked to support her parents and siblings; so although she would have liked to pursue a professional career, she couldn't do so. In her free time, she loves to cook and sometimes makes a delicious, traditional chili pepper chicken dish to share with her family. 

With much effort, enthusiasm, and her husband's support, Julia started her small business selling cakes two years ago. She begins preparing the cakes early in the morning and works about 10 hours a day. She loves her job, and her customers come back for her friendly demeanor and her delicious products.

Julia is very grateful to Kiva lenders whose support will allow her to buy a small oven, cake stands, platters, and some ingredients and supplies needed for her business. This way she hopes to increase her sales and income, which she wants to use in the near future to build a house with good materials that will assure her daughter's well-being. Her current home is made of plywood, plastic, matting, and cardboard.

loans.use: to buy a small oven, cake stands, platters, and some supplies.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is single and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Araba sells cooked rice in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina, which she has done for nine years now. She uses her income to take care of herself and her family. She pays all the bills and her children's school fees. Araba will use this loan to purchase sacks of rice to cook and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a fish monger in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina. Esi has received no formal education.  She is divorced and has five children. Esi has been a fish monger for 40 years now. She uses her income to help pay her grandchildren's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy fish in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has six children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Ama sells fried fish in Brenu Akyimu, near Elmina, which she has done for the past eight years. Her husband is a farmer. Ama uses her income to pay her children's school fees. Ama will use the loan to purchase fish in bulk. With the new profits, Ama plans to continue to grow her business so she can send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gilberta

texts.es:
Gilberta tiene 29 años, tiene 1 hijo y es madre soltera. Vive en la ciudad de Caacupé. Se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados hace 3 años, realiza sus ventas en zonas de Piribebuy y Paraguari de acuerdo a los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.
Cuenta que gracias a su amabilidad y buenos precios de sus productos ya tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre acude a ella a comprar sus productos. Su sueño es poder tener una gran tienda, y de esa forma darle a su hijo todo lo que necesita para tener una vida sin limitaciones. Gilberta nos dice que es muy sacrificado trabajar y ser madre, ya que ella se encuentra sola, pero que no se cansa, porque quiere dar lo mejor a su hijo.
Con el préstamo que solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y a kiva quiere comprar calzados y otras prendas de vestir para cubrir la demanda de pedidos de parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gilberta is 29 years old, and is a single mother with one child.  She lives in the city of Caacupé.  She has had a business selling clothing and shoes for 3 years.  She makes her sales in the Piribebuy and Paraguari neighborhoods on the basis of order she takes from her customers.

She tells us that because she is friendly and offers good prices on her products, she already has a good number of customers who always come to her to buy their products.  Her dream is to be able to have a big store, which would enable her to give her son everything he needs so that he can have a life without limitations.  Gilberta tells us that it takes a lot of self-sacrifice to work and be a mother, because she is on her own, but she doesn't get tired because she wants to give the best to her child.

With the loan that she is requesting from the Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva, she wants to buy shoes and other garments so that she can meet the demand based on her customer's orders.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul tiene 21 años, Nació     en   Ivirgarzama - Cochabamba. El cliente es una persona joven vive solo y no tiene un hijos, los escasos recursos economicos de sus padres  le permitieron estudiar hasta cuarto basico, Raúl  es una persona muy conocida en la zona trabajadora y responsable, indican sus vecinos y sus familiares; tiene muchas ganas de superación para para continuar sus estudios.

Hace 1  año que  se dedica a prestar servicio de moto taxi en la población de Ivirgarzama, es afiliado al Sindicato de Transporte  Carrasco Tropical, el cual a todos sus afiliados les otorga paradas para que los clientes puedan usar sus servicios; con los ingresos que le genera esta actividad  mantiene a sus padres, actualmente su herramienta de trabajo tiene algunas fallas mecánicas, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, para poder comprarse una nueva motocicleta, esto le ayudará a seguir manteniendo sus ingresos económicos para poder solventar sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Raúl, age 21, was born in Ivirgarzama – Cochabamba.  He is a young person who lives alone and does not have children.  His parents’ scarce financial resources only allowed him to go to school up to the fourth grade.

His neighbors and family members point out that Raúl is well-known in the area for being a hard-working and responsible person.   He has a great desire to improve himself in order to continue his educatin.

One year ago he started providing “mototaxi” [three wheeled motorized vehicle] service in the city of Ivirgarzama.   He belongs to the Carrasco Tropical drivers’ union.  All of the members are given stops so that the customers are able to use their services.  The income he generates from this business activity supports his parents.

Currently his work tool has some mechanical failures.  That is the reason he is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle.  This will help him to continue getting income in order to be able to pay for the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use for taxi service.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydia has seen her business grow well after she received the first loan. As the Muslim month of festivities begins, she is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stocks of second-hand clothing, which has had great sales during such periods.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Las mismas son conocidas en el barrio por la unión y el trabajo que hacen juntas.
María Concepción es la presidenta del grupo, ella es modista y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y eso le da muy buena fama.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of San Lorenzo, and its main objective is the individual growth of each member. The members are known in the neighborhood for their solidarity and their joint efforts.

María Concepción is the group's president. She is a dressmaker and has a steady clientele because she is well-known for the quality of her work. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread to continue working and filling her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 30 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past four years, John has been working hard to manage his mini supermarket, which sells food and domestic-use goods. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods like sugar, bread, salt and cooking oils to sell, and will help John to generate greater profits and expand his business, which will then increase his income. John hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the size of his supermarket. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more goods like sugar, bread, salt and cooking oils to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 58 years old, married and blessed with children who are now over 18 years old. She has been in farming and she sells charcoal at the same time. She started three years ago and she now earns a monthly income of KES 18,000. 

She is requesting a second loan of KES 40,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal and farm inputs. The profit she earns will help her build a rental house, clear her debts and expand her farming. 

She hopes to become a leading supplier of farm products in this region.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell and supplies for farming.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity  is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 27 years to 34 years. She describes herself as a focused and calm woman. 

She operates a retail clothes store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more items for reselling. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to diversify her business by buying dairy cows for milk.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Emmannuel

texts.en:
Emmannuel is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Emmannuel has been working hard to manage his laboratory, which sells test tubes, glucose and other pharmaceutical products. 

To help expand his business, Emmannuel has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.
