The loan will be used to buy test tubes, chloride, quinine and other inventory to sell, and will help Emmannuel to generate greater profits and help his family to increase their income and therefore improve their livelihood. Emmannuel hopes that in the future he will be able to have a larger laboratory. 

Emmannuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmannuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy test tubes, chloride, quinine and other inventory to sell

loans.name: Nigogo

texts.en:
Nigogo is 51 years old, married and has twin children, who are 17 years old and are in school. She operates a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and sells in a small stall in a busy street. She is a dedicated woman who always needs to prosper. She also sells fresh water in her home. 

She dreams of expanding her business and opening a new business in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy groceries such as tomatoes and potatoes for her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as tomatoes and potatoes for her store.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 49-year-old married woman with seven children from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in the fishing business since her husband has been a fisherman for more than 25 years now. The fishing business in the country is a booming venture.

Elvira joined CEVI a year ago because she likes the services offered by the organization. As of now, Elvira is requesting another loan since she already paid the previous loan she had with CEVI. She is asking for a loan worth 9000 PHP to buy new fishing nets, flashlights and a basin for fishing. She believes that this loan could be a great help to increase the daily catch of her husband.

Elvira dreams of expanding their business so that it could generate more income to be used for their daily expenses such as for food and the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, flashlights, and a basin for fishing

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 32 years old and has no child. For the past three years, she has been operating a retail shop, selling a variety of products. She learned these management skills when she was still under her parent's care in their shop. She buys her ingredients from the town.

She is seeking this loan so that she can purchase wheat flour, rice, and a sack of sugar. She wants to increase her inventory so that she can attract more customers and increase her income. Her underlying goal is to be able to open a wholesale store in the future.

loans.use: purchase wheat flour, rice, and a sack of sugar.

loans.name: Severino

texts.es: El señor Severino, tiene 37 años de edad, es de una familia humilde y de escasos recursos económicos, por lo tanto cultiva superficies muy pequeñas. Vive en la comunidad de Quebradas del municipio de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura  y la pecuaria desde hace 19 años produce y comercializa papa, frejol y cebolla para la alimentación de su familia el excedente los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. El señor Severino es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la educación y el bienestar de toda su familia. El señor Severino, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar un lote de terreno agrícola, para aumentar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Severino, 37, comes from a modest family with scarce financial resources, so he farms very small lots. He lives in Quebradas in the city of Mizque, Cochabamba Department. For 19 years, he has farmed, raised cattle, and produced potatoes, beans, and onions to feed his family and sell the surplus to merchants in Mizque. 

Severino is highly respected in his community for his dedication to his work and the support he provides for his family's education and well-being. He is requesting this loan to buy an agricultural lot to increase his production. This way, he will have higher income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an agricultural lot

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is aged 50. He has seven children aged between 10 and 25. All of them go to school. He wants the loan to add more items in the boutique such as cooking oil, sugar and many more. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more items such as cooking oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a 34 years old lady from Kisumu city and is married to Laban.  They have six children ages three to 15 years old.

She operates a food stall and has been in business for the last three years.  Dinah earns a monthly income of KES 3,000. 

Dinah is now taking out her first loan from KADET LTD to buy a stock of cooking oil and maize flour.  Her profits will be used to open other food joint outlets.  Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and maize flour.

loans.name: Mebo

texts.en:
Forty two year old Mebo is married and blessed with five children ages 22, 16, nine, eight and five. 

She sells fish, a business she started eight years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 38,000. 

Mebo has requested a second loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more fish to sell.  The profit she earns will help her pay her children’s school fees. 

She hope to prosper through the loans given to her by KADET LTD.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 36 years old.  She sells beans and sorghum; she has been selling those items for two years.

With the loan, Vestine wants to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.  The profits will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Josephas

texts.en:
Josephas is 28 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is single. For the past four years, Josephas has been working hard to manage his farm and produce shop, where he sells coffee and matooke (green plantain). 

To help expand his business, Josephas has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy coffee, beans, bananas, fertilizers and crop sprays, and will help Josephas to generate greater profits and buy more goods to increase his stock. This will help him to accumulate his income. Josephas hopes that in the future he will be able to open a new farm. 

Josephas is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josephas who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy coffee, beans, bananas, fertilizers and crop sprays.

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.en:
Euphrasie is 50 years old. She is a widow with three children. 

She sells sorghum and has been selling sorghum for the past seven years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to resell.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is 23 years old. She has one child, age 2. 

She has sold beans and sorghum for two years. She has requested the loan to buy more sorghum and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre is 50. He is a father of seven children between 12 and 22. 

The loan he requests will be used to buy more sorghum and beans to sell. Andre plans to use the profits for renovating the house.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en: Phanice is 35 years, married to Titus, and blessed with three children, ages 17, 16 and 7 years old. She owns a retail shop where she sells a variety of goods. She started this business five years ago and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She has requested a second loan of 15,000 KES to purchase two [barrels] of maize flour, two crates of sodas and a box of bar soaps. The anticipated profit she earns from her business will help her repay her loan. She hopes to see her business grow into a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase two barrels of maize flour, two crates of sodas and a box of bar soaps.

loans.name: Xaverine

texts.en:
Xaverine is 47 years old. She is a mother of nine children, age 3 to 23. All of her children were enrolled in schools. 

She sells sorghum and has been in this business for 15 years. With the loan, she wants to add more tons of sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more tons of sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 42 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his hardware shop, which sells bricks, ventilators and pipes. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bricks and pipes and other hardware to sell, and it will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and improve the family's income. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his shop. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy bricks and pipes and other hardware to sell.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children.  Two attend school. 

For the past 6 years, Enock has been hard at work managing his grocery store, which sells sugar, salt, cooking oil, pasho, and rice. 

To help expand his business, Enock has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil and other goods to sell, and will help Enock generate greater profits and increase his business.  This will improve his family's income.  Enock hopes to run a wholesale shop. 

Enock is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Enock who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil and other goods.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 35 year old married woman.  She has two children, ages two and six. 

She describes herself as a self-aggressive woman.  Virginia operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been in business for one year.  Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are passengers.  She says stiff competition is her biggest business challenge. 

Virginia will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy t-shirts to resell.  Her business goal is to become a wholesaler within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts to resell.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 30 years old.  She has four children ages one to nine.

She has spent five years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum and beans to sell. 

The profits from the business will be saved.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa, age 30, runs a charcoal business. She established this venture in 2010. 

She lives with her husband in Samburu, in the coastal area of Kenya.  They do not have a child yet.  Mejumaa has a strong understanding of operating her business. She works 11 hours a day six days per week.  At present, she faces the obstacle of high transport cost of her charcoal.

Mejumaa needs a loan to buy sacks of charcoal.  She is confident that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become an international businesswoman and permit her to set aside enough money to improve her family's living standard.

In the future, Mejumaa plans to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 36 years old, married and blessed with two children, age 10 and 5, that he supports. 

He is a mixed crop farmer doing small scale maize farming for the last 12 years. His monthly income is KES 10,000 

He applied for a loan of KES 70,000 from KADET Ltd. He will use it to purchase farm spray equipment and pay labour. 

The anticipated profits will be diversified to start a retail shop. His future dreams are to educate his children and achieve business success.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and spray equipment and to pay labour.

loans.name: Wilheford

texts.en:
Wilheford is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara, in Uganda.  He is married and has 4 children. For the past 31 years, Wilheford has been working hard to manage his farm, which sells cattle, milk, hides and skins. 

To help expand his business, Wilheford has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows and goats, and will help Wilheford generate greater profits and increase his farm outputs, which will increase his income. Wilheford hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his farm. 

Wilheford is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilheford who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two children 2 months and 2 years old. She describes herself as a business-oriented woman . 

She operates a barber shop where she provides hair cut services. She has been involved in this business for one year and employs three staff members. Her business is located within a busy business environment and her primary customers are ladies, children and men. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy two shaving machines. Her business goal is to run more barber shops within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy two shaving machines.

loans.name: Hamson

texts.en:
Hamson is 26 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in Uganda.  He is married and has one child.  For the past 3 years, Hamson has been working hard to manage his grocery, which sells pasho, rice, sugar, eggs and soda. 

To help expand his business, Hamson has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a fridge, rice, sugar and Pampers, and will help Hamson generate greater profits and increase his family's standard of living.  Hamson hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his grocery and have a wholesale business. 

Hamson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hamson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, rice, sugar and Pampers.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 37 years old and a mother of three children. 

She sells beers and sodas; she has spent 13 years in business. 

With the loan, she wants to add more sodas and beers to sell.  The profits from the business will be saved for the future of her business.

loans.use: to add more sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.es: Ruby  de 57 años de edad vive en el centro de Malambo, un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí ofrece los servicios de  internet, venta de recargas a celulares, llamadas,  transcripciones, fotocopiaje y también es un punto comercial donde vende mercancía variada como electrodomésticos menores, víveres etc. Ruby   de condición viuda y madre de 5 hijos hoy en las edades de 28 a 40 años, siempre ha trabajado con el fin de genera ingresos que beneficien su hogar; así fue que desde cuando organizó su familia, su esposo hoy fallecido,  traía mercancía de un lugar fronterizo de Colombia y ella la vendía, esta fue la forma en la cual construyó el capital, que hoy se ha convertido en su actual microempresa, a la que hace 3 años,  agregó el servicio de un café internet y poco a poco otros servicios afines, con los cuales ha salido adelante y se ha sostenido en el mercado. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y también ofrece mercancías, que compra en mayor volumen a tiendas y misceláneas del sector y que se han convertido en sus compradores fijos. Ruby es una mujer valiente que diariamente se esfuerza en hacer bien su trabajo , por eso su horario es desde las 8 de la mañana y muchas veces no ha cerrado su local siendo las 10 de la noche. No obstante espera incrementar sus ingresos, para continuar generando cada vez mayor bienestar, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará víveres, electrodomésticos menores, que tiene encargados así como insumos para provisionar su café internet y comprará un computador mas.    Con su inversión de credikiva ampliará su capital de trabajo y tendrá un dinero suficiente, para comprar productos de oportunidades que traen consigno importantes descuentos, que Ruby podrá aprovechar y esta es justamente la razón de éxito de Credikiva.
texts.en:
Ruby, 57, lives in Malambo, a neighborhood located in the city of Barranquilla. In her store, she offers internet service, prepaid phone cards, phone calls, transcripts, and photocopies and sells a variety of merchandise such as small appliances, groceries, and so forth. Ruby is a widow and mother of 5 children ages 28 to 40. She has always worked to generate income for her household. When she started her family, her now deceased husband brought merchandise from the Colombian border for her to sell. This is how she accumulated the working capital to start her current small business. Three years ago, she added an internet café and, slowly, other related services, with which she has prospered in the market.

Her main customers are her neighbors. She also offers merchandise that she buys wholesale to local shops and other businesses that have become steady customers. Ruby is courageous and strives daily to do a good job, which means her store opens at 8 a.m. and often doesn't close until 10 p.m. Still, she hopes to increase her income to keep improving her circumstances and, therefore, is requesting a loan to buy groceries, small appliances, and supplies for her internet café and to buy another computer. The loan will increase her working capital, giving her the money to buy highly discounted merchandise when the opportunity arises. This is precisely the reason for Kiva credit's success.

loans.use: to buy groceries, small appliances, and supplies for her internet café and to buy another computer.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has 10 children and four of them are currently in school. For the past seven years, Gerald has been working hard to manage his farm, which sells plants and food. 

To help expand his business, Gerald has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more farming nets and seeds, and will help Gerald to generate greater profits and sell more plants because he is buying more seedlings. Gerald hopes that in the future he will be able to start a retail business. 

Gerald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gerald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more farming nets and seeds.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is 54 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has fuve children and three of them are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Sulaiman has been working hard to manage his retail and dairy shop, which sells milk and other food stuffs. 

To help expand his business, Sulaiman has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more plates, jugs, soap, sugar, fruits and cooking oil, and will help Sulaiman to generate greater profits and expand the business because he can now open up a supermarket. Sulaiman hopes that in the future he will be able to establish the supermarket in the area and expand his dairy farming. 

Sulaiman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sulaiman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more plates, jugs, soap, sugar, fruits and cooking oil.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is 48 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in Kinango district with her small family: her husband, Hamisi, and her two children, both attending the local school.

Tabu earns her living through the sale of foodstuffs at the market, and operating a greengrocery store. She is a very hardworking person and takes good care of her family. She dreams of venturing into more businesses.

Tabu has requested a loan to invest in her greengrocery business. She also plans to start a dry fish-selling business.  She will diversify her assortment of fruits and vegetables and attract new customers, thus expanding her businesses. With the loan, she plans to purchase fruits and vegetables and sacks of dry fish.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables and sacks of dry fish.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. For the past three years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential goods like sugar, salt, and soap. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more goods like bottled water and soap, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and allow him to finish his house. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to open a wholesale shop. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like sugar and soap for his general store.

loans.name: Gloria Alba

texts.es: Gloria  con su anterior credikiva, compró una máquina de coser, forros para asientos de motocicletas y tela para elaborar mangas y guantes para motociclistas. Con esta inversión logró ampliar sus ventas y hoy está muy satisfecha por los resultados;  esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, con el que comprará chalecos, forros y guantes, pues quiere incursionar en la línea de artículos de lujo, para que los motociclistas se vean aun más elegantes en sus vehículos. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecida, por la gran ayuda que me están brindando , que Dios los bendiga, y que nos sigan apoyando para prosperar mas en nuestro negocio y en nuestro bienestar familiar. “
texts.en: With her previous loan, Gloria bought a sewing machine, covers for motorcycle seats, and fabric to make sleeves and gloves for motorcyclists.  She increased sales with the loan and is satisfied with the results. Therefore, she is requesting a new loan to buy vests, covers, and gloves so that she can offer upscale merchandise that will make the motorcyclists seem more dashing on their vehicles. Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: "I am very grateful for your tremendous support. May God bless you, and may you continue to support us so that our businesses may proper and our families thrive."

loans.use: to pay cash for materials at wholesale and to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jerame

texts.en:
Jerame is 24 years old and from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two young boys, ages 3 and 6. Her husband is a baker. 

Jerame has been engaged in making and selling pots for a profit. She is also into a sari-sari store (variety store) business. Her businesses started two years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy stock for her store like canned goods, noodles, seasoning and toiletries, and materials for house renovation. The income that she will generate from her store will be used to buy healthy meals for her family and pay for school fees.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store like canned goods, noodles, seasoning, and toiletries, and materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Las Franciscanas Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Las Franciscanas  es un grupo muy constante y trata siempre de mejorar, son personas muy entusiastas, cabe destacar que son sumamente agradables y simpáticas, todas ellas con sus actividades en marcha con mucho sacrificio siguen adelante con el grupo.
Cinthia vende todo tipo de tortas y recibe pedido de muchas personas, es por ello que le está yendo muy bien, ya que sus tortas son muy ricas y apreciadas por sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar, dulce de leche y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus tortas y así seguir ayudando a su familia con los gastos del día a día.
texts.en: The women of Las Franciscanas group are very tightly knit and always trying to improve their lot in life. They are very enthusiastic, and above all extremely friendly and nice people; all of them have businesses that they keep afloat thanks to many sacrifices and keep going forward together with the group. Cinthia sells every type of cake and receives many orders, which is why her business is going strong, since her cakes are very tasty and very appreciated by her customers. She asks for this loan in order to buy flour, butter, sugar, dulce de leche, and other ingredients in order to be able to continue baking and helping her family with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, sugar, dulce de leche, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale bananas.

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa is married and has three children. She has received schooling through middle school. Abenawa has been a fishmonger in Brenu Auyinim near Elmina for 15 years. Her husband is a fisherman. Abenawa uses her income to pay for her grandchildren's school fees. She will use this loan to purchase more fish. With the new profits, Abenawa plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Yusuf has been working hard to manage his food sales business, where he sells matoke and beans. 

To help expand his business, Yusuf has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand his business by buying more matoke and beans, and will help Yusuf to generate greater profits. Yusuf hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business to neighboring areas. 

Yusuf is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yusuf who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more matoke (plantain bananas) and beans

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es:
Las 10 integrantes cuentan con actividades comerciales variadas, cada una de ellas se esfuerzan siempre al máximo por poder superarse y también por medio de su trabajo poder ayudar a sus familias.
Eulogia es una de las miembros, ella se dedica al tejido de Ñanduti, que es un tejido típico del Paraguay.Comenta que aprendió de su familia este arte y que le encanta lo que hace, ya que es algo muy típico nuestro.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, como así también agujas para poder seguir trabajando y tejiendo sus hermosos trabajos.
texts.en: The ten members of the group have various commercial activities; each one of them always gives her best to improve her lot in life and to be able to help her family thanks to her work. Eulogia is one of the members. She embroiders Ñanduti ("spider web") lace, a typical Paraguayan type of embroidery. She tells us that she learned this art from her family, and that she loves her work because it is very representative of her country. She asks for this loan in order to buy cloth, thread, and needles, so as to be able to continue her beautiful embroidery work.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes De Pirayu Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que se han unido con el propósito de ayudar a sus familias a tener una vida mejor y sin privaciones. Ellas son muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que desean salir adelante y por medio de su esfuerzo ayudar a los suyos.
La Sra. Maria Antonia es la presidenta del grupo, cuenta que se dedica al tejido de Ñanduti, tejido típico paraguayo, y solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos para poder seguir tejiendo y de esa forma seguir trabajando y dando a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
These 17 women got together to help their families have better lives and no hardships. They are hardworking and enterprising; they want to get ahead and help their own through their efforts.

Maria Antonia is the group's president. She says she weaves in the Ñanduti style, a traditional Paraguayan weave. She is requesting the loan to buy fabric and thread to continue weaving, working, and providing for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the west Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his small business of selling timber. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 300,0000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber, and it will help Godfrey to generate greater profits after selling his increased inventory. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be the leading timber dealer in the Kampala subregion. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Godfrey, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but they have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members (a sister).  She has been in this business for two years.  She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT- SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes, clusters of bananas and sugarcane. She generates additional income through selling airtime, beer and local gin.  She works from her home and sells to all categories of people at retail seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to see her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked food stall and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like bananas, tomatoes, sugarcane and banana leaves.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is 71 years old and has a sari-sari store business in Talibon, Bohol. This business has been running for 10 years now. 

She is married with eight grown children who are mostly on their own. She has is used to working hard since she has been raising her children. Agapita's husband works as a fisherman for their needs.  She is asking for a loan to buy rice, feed and soft drinks for her store.

In the future, she hopes to save enough so she can live in comfort while enjoying her golden years.

loans.use: to buy rice, feed and soft drinks

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 28-year-old married woman. She has a son who is 10 years old. She describes herself to be a humble woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells items such as tomatoes, mangoes, bananas, potatoes, snacks, etc.  She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located near a busy town and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for resale. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, her business will have been successful.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 29 years old married to David and are blessed with a five year old child. She runs a beauty salon business which she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES. 25,000. 

She has requested for a second loan of KES 35,000 to start another line of business that is to open a charcoal store for additional income for the family.

The profit she earns will aid her repay her loan as well as care for her family's basic needs. Her dream is to see her business expand by opening other branches.

loans.use: to start another line of business that is to open a charcoal store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and honest woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for resell. Her business goal is to open more similar clothes  retail store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have been successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a 43 year old woman who works in her farm in Talibon, Bohol. She is married with 7 children.
The oldest is 22 and the youngest is 7 years old. Her farming business started 10 years ago to help her husband who is also working in their farm and is doing fishing at night. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pay for labor.

She works hard to support her family so she can provide for their needs and they can live in comfort. 
In the future, she hopes to have a bigger income out of her business so she can improve their current living status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pay for labor

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 3 years. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as sugar, salt, flour, sodas, bread etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a conducive business area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of household items. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more household items. Her business goal is to run another retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more household items.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 35 years old married to Ezekiel and blessed with three children aged 13, 11 and eight years respectively.  She sells clothes, a business she started 14 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000. 

She has requested for a second loan of KES.30,000 to purchase two bales of jackets for sale.She will use the anticipated profit to open up laundry services. 

Her dreams are to see her business expand, educate her children and lead a better life.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of jackets for sale.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion and her husband work as farmers for 10 years now in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has one daughter who is already an adult. They plant and harvest rice in their land for an income. This is her only source of livelihood right now so she wanted to take good care of her farm. This provide her family an income and a source of daily consumption. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. Her profit will be reinvested in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Comba

texts.fr: Mme Coumba   habite dans la ville principale, mariée et mère de famille s’active dans le commerce depuis quelques années, elle part en Mauritanie acheter des thioups, des basins, des Khartoum  etc. pour venir au Sénégal les vendre. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 pour aller en voyage acheter ses marchandises, c’est une habituée dans ce domaine et elle a des clients qui lui sont fidèles  dès réception de la marchandise elle l’écoule facilement. Mme Coumba veut diversifier ses produits et au lieu d’aller en Mauritanie seulement elle envisage dans le futur d’aller dans les pays d’Europe, d’Asie, etc. Avec les bénéfices réalisés elle pourra épargner, améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Comba lives in the city. She is married with children. She has been working in sales for a few years, traveling to Mauritania to buy various fabrics such as thioup, bazin, khartoum, etc., which she brings back to sell in Senegal. 

She is seeking a loan of 200,000F to travel abroad to replenish her stock. She has a good command of this practice, and she can count on a loyal customer base to buy her merchandise upon arrival. 

Mrs. Comba is planning to diversify her selection of merchandise. Instead of going only to Mauritania, she would like to travel all over Europe, Asia, etc. With her profits, she will bolster her savings and improve her family’s food situation.

loans.use: to buy thioup and bazin fabrics in Mauritania for sale in Senegal.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is from Bohol, Philippines. She has been involved in a fish selling business for more than ten years now. Her husband is a fisherman.

Flora works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the education of their children. 

Flora has been a member of CEVI for some time now. Currently, she is requesting a loan worth 11,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets and other fishing materials for her husband. She deemed it wise to have new nets in order to improve her husband's daily catch. With the loan, she can have more fish to sell to the people in their place.

Flora wants to improve her business so that it can generate more income for the family, and she will become financially capable of sending her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and other fishing materials for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Ana Mirna

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y mariscos, vive con su esposo una hija de 16 años, la vivienda en la que reside es propia, ella inició la venta de las tortillas desde hace 10 años, la venta de los mariscos la está realizando hace seis meses trabajando de lunes a domingo, su intención es tener las alternativas para generar ingreso a su hogar.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprarse maíz, leña, gas, que son necesarios para la producción de las tortillas, también invertirá una parte en la compra de pescado fresco y camarones, este préstamo ayudará a que pueda cubrir las exigencias de los clientes manteniendo un buen nivel de inventarios.

La aspiración de Ana es a futuro poderse comprar un vehículo propio, en el cual pueda movilizarse con el negocio de mariscos, al mismo tiempo crecer y darle empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Ana sells tortillas and seafood and lives with her husband and 16-year-old daughter in their own home. Ana has been selling tortillas for 10 years and started selling seafood six months ago. She works Monday to Sunday, hoping to have alternative means of generating household income.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, wood, and gas, which are necessary to make tortillas. She will also buy fresh seafood and shrimp. This loan will help her meet customer demand and maintain adequate inventory. Ana's dream it to buy her own vehicle to transport seafood, grow the business, and provide jobs to other people.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, gas, fresh seafood, and shrimp.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 26 years old.He is married to Magdalene and together they have one child. He operates a quarry and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to acquire another quarry site and also pay his laborers.

He hopes to start a business for his wife so that she can also contribute in bringing income.

loans.use: to pay for an extra quarry site.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is a business woman with one child from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in "Kalamay making" for more than twenty years now. "Kalamay" is made by extracting coconut milk from grated coconuts twice. Glutinous rice is added to the first batch of coconut milk and the mixture is ground into a paste. Brown sugar is added to the second batch of coconut milk and boiled for several hours to make sweetened coconut paste or latik. The mixture of ground glutinous rice and coconut milk is then poured into the latík and stirred until the consistency becomes very thick. It can be served hot or at room temperature especially when eaten with other dishes. Viscous Kalamay are often served cooled to make it less runny and easier to eat. This business is very lucrative in Bohol provinces where it originates.

Severina is applying for a loan worth 8000PHP to buy additional materials and ingredients for Kalamay making. She is optimistic that through this loan she could improve the current business into a more profitable one because of the additional capital. 

Severina dreamed of making her business grow so that it will generate more revenue to be used for their expenses and reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and ingredients for Kalamay making

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia is a 57 year old woman from Getafe, Bohol. She is married with nine children, her eldest is 26 years old and her youngest is 7 years old. She is engaged in fishing and selling seashells to her friends and customers. She is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net that she can use to have more productive nights at sea.  A new fishing net will replace her old ones and will assure her and her family of a better income. 

In the future, she hopes to have another business that she can start so she can have another source of income and provide her family of their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Lean is 41 years old. She is from Loon, Bohol and married with seven children. Her eldest is 14 and her youngest is 1 years old. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for five years now. Lean works hard for her children's needs and wishes to help her husband who is a welder. 

She is asking for a loan to buy grower feed, fattener feed and gestating feed. This will help Lean so she can be assured of having healthy pigs in the coming months, giving her a better return on her investment. 

In the future, she hopes to be able to send her children to school and see them graduate and a have successful life.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cezar is a 32 year old married man from Bohol, Philippines. He has a five year old son. Cezar is currently engaged in hog raising business and grocery or variety store for several months now. These are the sources of their income which they used to finance their daily needs.
Cezar is a hardworking man with determination to improve their way of living. Cezar joined CEVI to avail the financial services and trainings offered by the organization. He is asking for a loan worth 5000PHP to buy more piglets to raise and feeds for the hogs. 
Cezar hopes of improving his business to increase his income. Moreover, he wants to save for the education of his son in the coming days.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and feeds

loans.name: Marufe

texts.en:
Marufe is 34 year old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children to support. She is dependent in her income in buying and selling of products and merchandise as well as operating a Sari-sari store. She is asking for a loan to buy stocks of noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, snack food, toiletries and seasoning. This will further boost her income, giving her the chance to provide better for her family's needs. 

The income that she will generate will be spent on family daily consumption, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, snack food, toiletries and seasoning

loans.name: Surja Maya

texts.en: Surja Maya is 45 years-old.  She is married and has one child, aged 25.  In 2002, she established  her butcher shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys chickens for her business.  In the future, Surja Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   In Nepal, the meat is always fresh.  In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo.  The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk.  With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices.  This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en: Sabitri is 33 years old.  She is married and has one child, who is 9.  In 2004, she established her furniture-manufacturing business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy wood for her business.  In the future, Sabitri plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using a little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: To buy some wood

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita is 28 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 8 and 2. In 2000, she established her religious statue making business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Ramita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her religious statue making business

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is an artisan who specializes in wood carvings and masks as well as coconut shell sculptures. She would like to stock up on raw materials.

Eka has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story:

Eka is inspired by her children and family. "My children are my biggest motivation to work. I always keep my spirit up and go on strong for my children. Thanks to them I do not falter, and I am encouraged to develop new ideas and designs for sculptures."

"I want to express my great thanks for the microcredit. For me, your support is always motivating me to do better, improve my work, and develop my workshop."

Use the link below to view Eka's carvings and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7351

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her wood and coconut shell carvings

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
Jose, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 14 y 18 años de edad, la vivienda en la que habita es familiar, desde hace 20 años se dedica a trabajar la tierra cultivando maíz y frijol, recibiendo el apoyo de sus hijos.

Solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la compra de abonos, herbicidas, insecticidas, que serán aplicados a la siembra con el objetivo de evitar la maleza y las plagas.

Este préstamo ayudará a que José pueda darle una condición mejor al negocio y aumentar la producción de maíz y frijol, su aspiración a futuro es obtener una vivienda propia para su familia, y desarrollarse más en su trabajo agrícola.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and their two children of 14 and 18 years of age. The house with they live in is of the family. Twenty years ago he began making a living cultivating corn and beans, and receives support from his children. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide which will be applied to the crops with the purpose of avoiding weeds and plagues. 

This loan will help Jose provide his business with better conditions and increase his corn and bean production. His future aspiration is to have his own house for his family and to further develop in his agricultural work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah  is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (father and mother).  She has a business of selling used skirts and blouses. She has been in this business for two years selling to all categories of people on retail. She has applied for a loan of 200000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used skirts and blouses.  Besides this used clothes business she generates additional income through selling used shoes. Her major business challenge includes transportation and rainy season because she works in an open place. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she start selling on wholesale only and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses  includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used skirts and blouses

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is 51 years old, married to a farmer and carpenter. She has four children, her eldest is 30 and her youngest is 17. Ophelia and her husband farms rice both for sale and for her family's consumption.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor during land preparation. This is very important to Ophelia for the success of her crops' yield. Her income will then be used for consumption, school fees and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor during land preparation

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito is 42 year old married man from Bohol, Philippines and has two children. He is engaged in hog raising business together with his wife for more than three years now. This is the source of their income. 

Tito works hard to earn a living to support the family. As of this time, Tito is applying for a loan worth 7000PHP to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for the hogs. 

Tito's greatest dream is to improve his business to augment his income. Moreover, he wants to send his children to school for better learning and education. He also plans of saving some of his revenue for future use and investments.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds for the hogs

loans.name: Relinda

texts.en:
Relinda is a 49 year old married woman from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married to a farmer and they have five children, the oldest is 21 and the youngest is 6.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pay for laborer who will be helping in her farm during land preparation. This will better prepare Relinda on her farm when the additional capital that is needed is available. She hopes that her children will benefit on her hard work, giving them a good education for a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pay for labor

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is a resident of Bohol, Philippines. He is engaged in nipa weaving business for about four years now. Nipa is a palm and its leaves are gathered for weaving. The weaved palm leaves are sold to the market and used as a roof in some houses in the Philippines and are favored by many because of its cool effect and ambience feeling inside the house.
Edgardo works very hard to earn a living. He is asking for a loan worth 13000PHP to buy additional materials  for nipa weaving such as nipa, nylon and others. Edgardo believes that this loan would be a great help for him in expanding his business to augment his income.

loans.use: to buy additional materials  for nipa weaving such as nipa, nylon and others

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 54-year-old married woman with four children from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in cosmetics and beauty products retail business for about five years now. This provides her income that she needs for their expenses and for the education of her children. Evangeline is a hardworking woman willing to grab every opportunity to earn a living. 

As of this time, Evangeline  is requesting for a loan worth 10000PHP to be used to purchase additional stock or supplies of cosmetics such as make-up, perfume, and others. She believes that she can cater more clients if she has numerous stocks to offer to her clients. And with it, her income will increase because of her sales.

Evangeline hopes to make reinvestment in this retailing business. She also dreamed of seeing her children as professionals someday since her foremost concern is to earn so that she can continually send them to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock or supplies of cosmetics such as make-up, perfume, etc.,

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is a 36 year old woman from Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. She is a business-minded woman who is engaged in both fishing and Sari-sari store business. She is asking for a loan to buy crab trap, rice and fishing nets. A loan will serve as an additional investment so she can further improve her business for better profit. Whatever income that she will generate will be used to help her family on food and basic household needs like electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy crab trap, rice and fishing nets

loans.name: Wangninan Group

texts.fr: «WANGNINAN» est un groupe composé de sept personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Clémentine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans. Clémentine est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Eloï. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Clémentine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Clémentine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Clémentine mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (sucre, lait et farine de manioc) à son domicile. Clémentine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Clémentine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe «WANGNINAN» un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
"WANGNINAN" is a group composed of seven persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Clémentine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 40 years old. She is married to a driver named Eloï. They have four children, all in school and in their care. Clémentine lives together with her children and husband and ensures along with her husband that the household expenses are covered. 

Clémentine did not attend school. To cope with her different expenses, she has a business selling a variety of products (sugar, milk, and cassava flour) out of her home. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin .

To respond further to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and to make more profit, Clémentine, along with the other members of the group WANGNINAN, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loan were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, and cassava flour

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros, asimismo podemos encontrar playas hermosas y sobre todo sus pobladores son muy amables.  Jose es padre soltero, debido a problemas ajenos su esposa lo abandono y tuvo que criar solo a sus tres hijos por quienes ha luchado mucho con tal de darles una vida digna y sobre todo sean mejores que el.  Jose anteriormente se dedicaba a los trabajos de construcción, pero debido a que no eran muy seguidos no tenían suficientes ingresos, con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a la ayuda de un amigo consiguió trabajo en un establo, actualmente trabaja en ese establo dándole alimentación a los animales que se crían allí, asimismo ordeña las vacas para la venta de leche, realiza las labores de limpieza y cuidado de los animales y también supervisa el litraje que se obtiene de la ordeña; el esta muy a gusto con su trabajo y por ello cree que le va bien por sus ganas de salir adelante y por su responsabilidad.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que le han brindado podrá comprar una cocina, ollas y algunos enceres necesarios para su vivienda ya que debido a un pequeño accidente se quedo sin vivienda y el dueño del establo le ha brindado un pequeño cuarto para que pueda vivir junto a su familia, de esta manera el podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y poder seguir trabajando, salir adelante y poder luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Darle una profesión a sus hijos y poder tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jose is 52, and lives in Imperial, a city known for having a warm and inviting climate. Agriculture is carried on, especally the growing of cotton, corn and other crops. As well, beautiful beaches are found there, and above all, the inhabitants are very friendly. 

Jose is a single father. Due to problems that had nothing to do with him, his wife left him, and he had to raise his three children on his own. He has really struggled to give them a decent life, and above all, so that they will be better off that he is.

Jose previously worked in construction jobs, but due to the fact that they were not one right after the after, he didn't have sufficient income. With a great deal of effort, and thanks to a friend's help, he got work in a stable. Currently, he works in that stable feeding the animals that are raised there. 

As well, he milks the cows for milk sales. He does cleaning and looks after the animals, and also supervises the measuring of what is obtained from the milking. He is very at ease with his work, and believes that it is going well because he is responsible and has the desire to succeed.

Jose is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as with the support he has been offered, he will be able to buy a stove, pots and some necessary furniture for his home. Due to a small accident he was left without a home, and the stable owner has offered him a small room so that he can live there with his family. That way he will be able to have a better quality of life, continue working, succeed in life and be able to make his greatest dream a reality: To see that his children have good occupations, and to have his own house.

loans.use: To purchase a stove, pots and kitchen things.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet gained much success from her first loan. She believes that the same process will continue especially now that the muslim month of festivities is on. Most people buy many clothes at this time. Juliet is now applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of clothes.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and children's shoes.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 5 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the coordinator of her group, Mata de Palma en Desarrollo ("Mata de Palma in development" called like this because this is the name of the community). The group is is located, in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Altagracia plans to use her loan to invest in her clothing sales. She has set up a clothing sales business, so she will use her loan to buy new clothes to sell. She hopes to eventually set up a store where her customers can come to her instead. She also wants to finish building a house with her sales profits and be able to help her children acquire a college education.

As a member of Esperanza, Altagracia joined a borrower group that includes some of her very good friends. She says all of them are hard workers and dedicated to their businesses. She dreams of having her house built, and of seeing all her children go to school and becoming professionals. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy new clothes

loans.name: Sandra Del Rosario

texts.es:
Sandra es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive al lado de su hermana y de tu tía, a quien quiere muchísimo porque desde muy niña quedo huérfana y ella la crio y saco adelante, ahora ella la apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo porque ya tiene una edad avanzada y necesita de muchos cuidados. Su vivienda se encuentra en la ciudad e Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, algodón, entre otros.  Rosario es muy trabajadora y desde joven aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente sobre todo porque su tía no tenía muchos ingresos y veía que muchas veces no le alcazaba para los gastos del hogar, así como también los gastos de estudios de ella y de su hermana, luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de comida y bebidas gaseosas, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque tiene una buena sazón.

Sandra está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una refrigeradora para poder almacenar los productos que utiliza para la preparación de sus platillos, ya que actualmente la refrigeradora que tiene se encuentra malograda y siempre se descompone, asimismo comprara mercadería para su negocio como bebidas gaseosas al por mayor, de esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y podrá trabajar y luchar para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar una carrera y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia”.
texts.en:
Sandra is 21 and lives with her sister and aunt, whom she loves dearly because Sandra was orphaned at an early age, and her aunt raised and provided for her. With her income, Sandra can now help her aunt, who is quite old and needs care. Her home is in Ica, a city known for being warm and welcoming. Farming is important here, especially growing grapes, asparagus, cotton, and other crops. 

Sandra del Rosario works hard, and as a youngster learned to earn a living from the sweat of her brow, mostly because her aunt's income was low and often didn't cover the household expenses and education expenses for her and her sister. With great effort and her savings, she managed to start her business selling food and sodas. She works about 10 hours a day and serves about 15 customers. She believes her business thrives because she is very friendly with her customers and her food tastes great. 

Sandra is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to their support she will be able to buy a refrigerator to store the ingredients she uses to prepare her dishes. Her current refrigerator is in bad shape and always breaking down. She will also buy merchandise such as wholesale sodas so that she can increase her income and work hard to make her greatest dream a reality: "Get a diploma and give my family a better life."

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and merchandise (sodas).

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a master weaver who specializes in Zapotec rugs. To continue production he would like to increase his workshop's physical space and invest in the purchase of pedal looms and in raw materials such as wool.

Alberto has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

Alberto is the fourth generation in a family dedicated to weaving Zapotec rugs. "I remember as a child watching my father working on the loom while my mother and grandmother carded and dyed the wool so that the men could weave it. We shear the wool, spin it and dye it with natural dyes from cochineal insects, pomegranate peels, and bark from huajal, oak and pecan trees. Almost all the rocks and flowers here yield natural colors that we can use in our work.  Words fail me to express how your support and trust make me feel. This interest-free microcredit will enable me to continue supporting my family and helping the people in my community that are looking for work. Gracias!"

Use the link below to view Alberto's rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4559

loans.use: to increase the size of his workshop and purchase raw materials and new pedal looms

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
Ana, vive en casa familiar con su esposo y sus hijos que tienen las edades de 15 y 18 años, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos, el cual realiza desde hace dos años, este surgió con el apoyo de su esposo para poder obtener ingresos esta ubicado en la residencia, no tienen un horario fijo para atenderlo.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería, con la intención de aumentar el negocio y proveer a sus clientes aquellos productos que sean más necesarios por ejemplo de huevos, productos lácteos, embutidos, azúcar, productos de aseo personal, pues esta inversión mejorará el nivel de inventario de la tienda.

Su objetivo es tener un negocio lo suficientemente rentable y abastecido para contar con la preferencia de los clientes, esto le ayudará a mejorar también la manutención de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives in a home with her husband and children that are 15 and 18 years old. She runs a domestic products store which she began two years ago. She started it with the support of her husband to receive earnings while staying at home. They do not have a set schedule to attend to the store.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of goods, with the intention of expanding the business and providing her customers with those products that are most necessary. These include eggs, dairy products, preserved meats, sugar and personal hygiene products. This investment will improve the store's inventory levels. 

Her objective is to have a sufficiently profitable and stocked business to provide her customers with their preferences. This will help her to improve the support she gives her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs, dairy products, preserved meats, sugar and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas witnessed a tremendous growth in sales from the first loan she received. Dorcas believes she can make more sales now that it is the muslim month of festivities at the coastal town. She is asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase more clothes.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothes.

loans.name: Sylvanus

texts.en: Sylvanus purchased a welding machine from the loan he had applied for. He states that he did not face any challenges during the loan term. Although the cost of doing business rose, he would like to apply for another loan in order to purchase a drill and a grinder. He is grateful for such support.He is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase more welding materials e.g soldering rods.

loans.use: To purchase welding materials e.g. soldering rods.

loans.name: Audelio Humberto

texts.es:
El señor Audelio tiene 31 años de edad, esta casado y tiene una pequeña niña. Él se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde su niñez, ya que en el lugar donde vive este trabajo es el mas implementado. Apredio dicho trabajo de su padre, con quien a lo largo de toda su vida ha ayudado a cultivar las tierras para poder llevar el sustento a su familia. Hoy que Ha formalizado un nuevo hogar junto a su esposa y su niña tiene que trabajar muy duro para poder llevar el alimento a su casa. Audelio,  tambien se dedica al destazo de cerdos desde hace unos 10 años y aprendio tambien de su padre, ya que él desarrolla esta actividad, antes lo hacian juntos pero hoy cada uno de ellos lo hace por su parte. Audelio a notado que dicho rubro de trabajo le ayuda mucho con los ingresos, ya que los de la agricultura no son muchos como para poder brindarles una exelente vida a su esposa e hija.

El compra los productos que utiliza en la ciudad mas cercana, ubicada a unos 8 kilometros de su casa, él tiene que trasladarse a veces a pie, ya que el transporte para su casa es escaso, tiene que hacerlo a pie y cuando lleva el producto tiene que trasladarlo en un vehiculo que contrata en la ciudad para que los lleve y esto le genera un costo extra para su bolsillo ya que le sale mas caro.

El crédito lo invertira en la compra de 5 cerdos y en harinilla para alimentarlos. Él compra en esta cantidad,ya que asi le salen mas comodos los precios y tiene un buen marjen de ganancia cuando los vende ya destazados y asi puede seguir comprando mas y llevando mas ingresos para su familia.

La principal necesidad que sera satisfecha con el crédito, es que podra comprar mas animales de una sola vez y tambien la comida para ellos asi tendra un ahorro ya que todo lo trasladara a su casa de una sola vez y realizara un solo costo de compra y traslado.

Su vida mejorara grandemente, ya que sus ingresos seran mas altos con la venta de la carne de dichos animales y de esta forma tendra un flujo de efectivo suficiente para poder comprar mas producto y llevar mas alimento a su casa.

En el futuro planea poder realizar arreglos a su casa con el dinero que se puede ir ahorrando con la venta de los productos y espera poder darle una muy buena educacion a su hija y poder guiarla por el buen camino ya que el espera que su vida no sea ten estropeada como la que él vivio en su niñez.

 El se siente muy contento con la ayuda que se le esta dando, ya que sus planes los podra realizar en mas corto tiempo de lo que espera.
texts.en: Audelio is 31 years old, married, and has a young daughter. He has been a farmer since he was a child, since in the place where he lives agriculture is the most represented sector. He learned the trade from his father, whom he helped all his life to grow crops to put bread on the table. Now that he has founded his own home, together with his wife and child, he has to work very hard in order to feed his family. Audelio has also reared pigs for about ten years, something which he also learned from his father, who keeps doing this to this day. They used to do it together but now each has their own pigs. Audelio says that this part of his activity helps a lot to increase his income, since cultivating his land is not enough to give his wife and child the good life they deserve. He buys the products he uses in a nearby town, some eight kilometres from his house; sometimes, he has to do this journey on foot, since transport to the area where his house is located is scarce. When he is loaded with products, he has no choice but to hire a vehicle to take him back to his house, and this is an extra cost, more expensive than walking. He will invest the loan in the purchase of five pigs and meal to feed them. He buys five pigs because it is cheaper and thus he can turn a good profit when he sells the carcases. Then he can buy more and bring more income to his family. The main need this loan fulfils is to enable Audelio to buy more than one pig and to buy meal at the same time: in so doing, he saves money, since he only has to pay for one trip to bring everything home. His life will be greatly improved by this, since he will turn a greater profit when selling the meat, giving him more money with which to buy more products and put more bread on the table. In the future, he plans to repair his home with what money he can save from the profits he will have made; he also hopes to give his daughter a good education and guidance, since he hopes she will have a better life than what he himself had to live through when he was a child. He is very grateful for Kiva's help, since it will enable him to carry out his plans sooner than expected.

loans.use: to buy five pigs and meal to feed them.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es:
Jose, vive con su esposa y tres hijos quienes dependen económicamente de él, se dedica a la administración de una discoteca móvil y sonido estacionario, este negocio surge como una manera para ganarse la vida, lo aprendió desde hace mucho y es el trabajo que hasta el momento le ha permitido apoyar a su familia y cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de sonido, y mejora y actualizaciones del aparato de la disco, y la compra de consola de audio, este crédito le ayudará a mejorar el equipo electrónico y poder ofrecer una mejor animación en los eventos sociales, dándole la facultad para poder ganarse nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de él es crear con una estructura más sofisticada para la disco, tener luces e iluminación interactiva que sea de atracción de los clientes.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and three children who are financially dependent on him.  He manages a mobile discotheque and sound station.  This business, which he learned a long time ago, arose as a way to make a living and so far, the income has allowed him to support his family and cover his children’s needs.

He is requesting the loan to purchase sound equipment, improve and update the disco’s apparatus, and purchase an audio console.  This loan will help him improve the electronic equipment and enable him to offer better disco animation at social events, giving him the ability to gain new customers and improve his income.

His dream is to create a more sophisticated structure for the discotheque, and to have interactive lights and illumination to attract customers.

loans.use: to purchase sound equipment and an audio console.

loans.name: Orlina

texts.es: Orlina  de 42 años  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena  y tiene una hija  de 25 años de edad, con quien sueña sea muy exitosa en lo que emprenda. Hace 17 años ella trabajó en una empresa pesquera, donde solo duró   7 meses por lo difícil de esa labor; no obstante y en la búsqueda de oportunidades de ingresos, le ofrecieron un kiosco, para desarrollar algún negocio y generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, conformado por su madre y su hija. Así fue como empezó a vender almuerzos y cervezas, logrando construir una clientela que poco a poco creció y así estuvo durante 4 años; pero  una vez estuvo posicionada fue robada y debió empezar en otro barrio en un lote suministrado por una amiga, al cual le agregó un techo, sillas, mesas e inició su actividad nuevamente;   en la medida en que este negocio creció contrató a su hermana y logró que su negocio se posicionara  y   ahorrar hasta comprar un lote, que adecuó, consiguiendo tener su propia casa. Posteriormente debió entregar el local donde funcionaba  el negocio, por eso  hizo adecuaciones a su lote y emprendió un restaurante y adicionó la venta de refrescos  y  cervezas y posteriormente licores y nuevamente adecuó una terraza que convirtiera hoy, en un lugar donde su clientela divierte bailando y compartiendo. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos, con el cual ha salido adelante en su condición de mujer cabeza de familia. Su experiencia data desde hace 12 años, cuando inició y aun está dispuesta a hacerlo crecer aun mas, porque sus ventas aumentan y debe tener un stock de bebidas fríos y licores disponibles, en épocas de muchas festividades y Orlina debe estar lista para hacer su mejor venta y genera cada vez más ingresos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cerveza, aguardiente, ron y wisky , lo que diversificaría su oferta respondiendo a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes.
texts.en: Orlina is 42 years old. She lives in the town of Cartagena and she has a 25-year-old daughter and she hopes her daughter will be successful in whatever she will undertake. 17 years ago she worked in a fish processing plant for 7 months only because that job was very difficult; notwithstanding this, while looking for job opportunities she was offered a stall and she accepted it to generate some business and to earn money to support her family, composed of her mother and her daughter.
